Spells like {@spell sunburst} and other effects that create powerful natural sunlight do not petrify the cavern troll, though it does become {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn after being exposed to such an effect.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cavern troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Charge
entries: Once per turn, if the centaur scout moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee spear attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The centaur scout makes two attacks: one with its spear and one with its hooves.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Cephal Lorentus is a 7th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: Cephal has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces Cephal Lorentus to 0 hit points, he must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, he drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller living creature that is {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take an additional 5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage as Cephal attempts to consume the victim's brain. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, or it is already at 0 hit points, it dies.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the chew spiders know the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spiders ignore movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. The target must make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Chief Sootscale has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of his allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Chief Sootscale deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Chief Sootscale that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and he doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, Chief Sootscale has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Sootscale makes two club attacks.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: The cleansed cultist has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, the cleansed cultist deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the cleansed cultist that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the cleansed cultist doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cleansed cultist makes three attacks: two with its shortsword and one with its dagger.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Release the Inmost Worm {@recharge 5}
entries: The cleansed cultist spends an action to expel a bloody worm from the scar on its forehead, targeting a creature within 30 feet. The creature must succeed at a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or the worm burrows into the creature's head, dealing 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage and incapacitating the target until the beginning of the cleansed cultist's next turn. On a successful save, the worm deals half damage and falls to the ground, vanishing, and the target is not {@condition incapacitated}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Corax is a 7th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks). Corax has the following ranger spells known:

trait.name: Archery
entries: Corax gains a +2 bonus to attack rolls he makes with ranged weapons (included in attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Corax makes two attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Cursed Guardian
languages: understands Common and Sylvan but can't speak

trait.name: Accursed
entries: The cursed guardian has vulnerability to all damage inflicted upon it by a worshipper of Erastil, and it has disadvantage on all saving throws to resist effects created by worshippers of Erastil.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The cursed guardian has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the cursed guardian moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the cursed guardian can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage, or 15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage if the target is {@condition grappled} by the cursed guardian.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) slashing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the cursed guardian can't {@action grapple} another target.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Dancing Lady's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). The Dancing Lady can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The Dancing Lady can use her action to polymorph into a Small {@creature bat}. While in bat form, she can't speak, her walking speed is 5 feet, and she has a flying speed of 30 feet. Her statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything she is wearing transforms with her, but nothing she is carrying does. She reverts to her true form if she dies.

action.name: Claw (fey form only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) necrotic damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

action.name: Drink Blood
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the Dancing Lady, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}, or one creature that is at half its maximum hit points or less. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the Dancing Lady regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Captivating Dance
entries: The Dancing Lady dances rhythmically, causing creatures of her choice that she can see within 30 feet and that can see her to make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition charmed}. A {@condition charmed} target must use its movement on its turn to move toward the Dancing Lady as expediently as possible, avoiding obvious danger, until adjacent the Dancing Lady. A target that begins its turn adjacent to the Dancing Lady and {@condition charmed} has its speed is reduced to 0 ft. As an action, a {@condition charmed} target can make a new saving throw, ending the effect for itself on a success. The captivating dance ends if the Dancing Lady is {@condition incapacitated} or can no longer move—or after 1 minute. A creature that succeeds at a saving throw against the captivating dance is immune to the Dancing Lady's captivating dance for 24 hours.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Darivan is a 11th-level cleric spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). Darivan has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Profane Leather
entries: Leather armor Darivan wears gains a +6 bonus, which ceases when he removes the armor.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Darivan makes two falchion attacks.

action.name: Falchion +2
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Bloom Regeneration
entries: When Darivan takes damage while located within the Cradle of Lamashtu, he can cry out a quick prayer to the Mother of Monsters, and filaments of fungus slither up into his wounded body. He regains 15 hit points as the filaments heal his wounds.

trait.name: Dream Haunting
entries: Davik can cast {@spell dream}, without using a spell slot or requiring components, to enter the dreams of someone who destroyed him. This link can be ended as though it were a 5th-level spell or by anything that can end a curse, preventing him from casting {@spell dream} against that target again.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If Davik is reduced to 0 hit points, his bones and gear melt into water that runs back into the river or seeps into the ground, leaving nothing behind. The next night, he rises again, completely healed, but with his unholy anger now directed at those who previously destroyed him as well as at the {@creature Stag Lord|PKB}. Davik can be put to rest permanently only when his unfinished business is taken care of.

trait.name: Rotting Stench
entries: A creature that is not undead that begins its turn within 10 feet of Davik must succeed at a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn. Creatures with advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks based on scent have disadvantage on this saving throw. On a success, a creature is immune to Davik's stench for 1 minute.

trait.name: Sure Possession
entries: Davik possesses a magical ranseur (a {@item +1 glaive|DMG|glaive +1}). If disarmed of the ranseur, or if he drops it, it melts into water; he can retrieve it by pulling it out of any body of water. If Davik is put to rest permanently by fulfilling his quest, his ranseur loses this ability and can be claimed by someone else.

trait.name: Water Walk
entries: Davik can walk on water without sinking.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Davik can use his Fearsome Gaze. He then makes two melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Ranseur +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fearsome Gaze
entries: Each creature of Davik's choice that is within 30 feet of him that he can see must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Davik's Fearsome Gaze for the next 24 hours.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't cold iron

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The nymph is a 7th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The nymph has prepared the following druid spells:

trait.name: Blinding Beauty
entries: When a humanoid that can see the defaced nymph starts its turn within 30 feet of the nymph, the nymph can force it to make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw if the nymph is not {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. If the save fails by 5 or more, the humanoid is {@condition blinded} permanently.

Otherwise, a humanoid that fails the saving throw is {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn, when it must repeat the saving throw on its next turn, becoming permanently {@condition blinded} on a failure or ending the effect on a success. Unless surprised, a humanoid can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the nymph until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the nymph in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Fey Weapons
entries: The nymph's weapon attacks are magical. When the nymph hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nymph has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Shame
entries: A defaced naiad queen has disadvantage on all rolls made against fey creatures, or any spellcaster who worships a deity or faith associated with nature or the First World. A character who understands the nature of this shame can attempt to forgive a defaced naiad queen (requiring an action by the forgiving creature) by speaking to it in a language she understands. The defaced naiad queen must attempt a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, the defaced naiad queen has disadvantage on all rolls until the end of her next turn.

If she rolls a natural 1 on this saving throw, her eyes are restored and she cries out in relief an instant before she vanishes, returning to the First World to live out a new life far from Thousandbreaths. As she does so, a wave of emotional thanks and inspiration infuse the character who forgave the nymph, granting them advantage on Intelligence checks and saves against fear effects for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nymph makes three melee attacks with her torturous touch.

action.name: Agonized Wail
entries: The nymph emits an agonized wail that affects all creatures (except defaced naiad queens) with 120 feet. Targets must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A successful save renders a creature immune to this defaced nymph's agonized wail for 1 minute.

action.name: Torturous Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 3d6 + 2}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Stunning Glance
entries: A nymph can turn the power of its primal displeasure on a single creature within 30 feet, which must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw each round at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Chittering Screech
entries: A derghodaemon can grind its mandibles and chitin plates together to form a distended and cacophonous scraping noise that can drive a mortal being insane. Anyone within 30 feet must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be affected by a {@spell symbol} spell (insanity). A creature that makes this save is immune to this derghodaemon's screech for 24 hours.

trait.name: Cloud of Misery
entries: A derghodaemon is surrounded at all times by an insect swarm (as the spell {@spell insect plague}) extending 5 feet from its space and moving with it without requiring {@status concentration}. The area surrounding the daemon is lightly obscured and acts as {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, as well as damaging all creatures adjacent to the daemon when it ends its movement. As a bonus action, it can {@status concentration|PHB|concentrate} to move the swarm away from itself up to 60 feet away, forming it into a 10-foot-radius sphere. It can move the swarm up to 60 feet each round thereafter as a bonus action to any point within 60 feet of itself. If it stops {@status concentration||concentrating}, the swarm disperses and reforms around the daemon at the beginning of its next turn. If the daemon takes 20 or more damage from an area effect while surrounded by the swarm, it is dispersed until the daemon uses a bonus action to reform it.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: A derghodaemon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: See Invisible
entries: A derghodaemon can see {@condition invisible} creatures and objects as if they were {@condition invisible}. It can see Ethereal creatures or objects, though they appear ghostly and translucent.

trait.name: Tearing Rend
entries: If a derghodaemon hits a creature with 2 or more claws in the same round, it deals an additional 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage. As a bonus action, it can increase this bonus damage to 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage and cause the target to gain one level of {@condition exhaustion} (as long as the target has no other levels of {@condition exhaustion}).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The derghodaemon makes five claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: Dog has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The doprillu's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Mask of Power
entries: If the doprillu's mask is removed, it loses its regeneration abilities, its immunity to {@condition exhaustion} and being {@condition incapacitated}, and it immediately gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}. If the doprillu puts the mask back on, it regains its abilities and loses all levels of {@condition exhaustion}. A creature can pull off the doprillu's mask with a successful {@dc 20} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check.

trait.name: Otherworldly Perception
entries: The doprillu can see {@condition invisible} creatures and objects as if they were visible.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The doprillu regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the doprillu takes cold damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the doprillu's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The doprillu makes three fist attacks, or if it has a {@condition grappled} creature, it makes two body strikes and a fist attack. Alternatively, if the doprillu makes a whirlwind throw, it makes a body strike as a ranged attack immediately afterward.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this {@action grapple} ends, the target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns, and the doprillu can't {@action grapple} another target.

action.name: Body Strike
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/50 ft., one creature. {@h}the doprillu uses a Medium or smaller creature it is {@action grapple|PHB|grappling} to strike another creature and deals 14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage to the target and half as much damage to the {@condition grappled} creature.

action.name: Whirlwind Throw
entries: The doprillu whirls a {@condition grappled} creature, using it to strike all creatures within 10 feet of the doprillu. All creatures in the area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. The {@condition grappled} creature takes half the amount of damage taken by each creature struck.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Dovan is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage from the effect, Dovan instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if he fails.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Dovan deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Dovan that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and he doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Dovan makes two ranged attacks with his daggers, or one melee attack with his rapier and one with his dagger.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20 ft./60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Hide in Plain Sight
entries: While the drainberry bush remains motionless, it gains advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks to appear to be an ordinary bush.

trait.name: Nature Empathy
entries: The drainberry bush can speak telepathically with animals and sentient plant creatures (as {@spell speak with animals}).

trait.name: Blood Berries
entries: The drainberry bush must drain blood from living creatures for sustenance. This causes clusters of bright red, highly nutritious berries to grow among its branches. Each cluster of berries lasts for 1 day, and a drainberry bush typically has 3 ({@dice 1d4 + 1}) clusters when encountered. When consumed, a cluster restores 14 ({@dice 2d8 + 5}) hit points and removes one level of {@condition exhaustion}. A creature can pluck a cluster of berries with a successful unarmed melee attack or Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check against the bush's AC. (If the drainberry bush is not hostile, it is also possible to purchase blood berries from it at a typical price of 200 gp per cluster.)

trait.name: Consume Berries
entries: As a bonus action, the bush draws nourishment from one cluster of its own blood berries, regaining 14 ({@dice 2d8 + 5}) hit points. That berry cluster wrinkles and dies.

trait.name: Drain Blood
entries: As a bonus action, if it has {@condition grappled} at least one creature, the drainberry bush can use its hollow thorns to siphon blood from the {@condition grappled} creatures. For each {@condition grappled} creature, a new cluster of blood berries immediately grows on the drainberry bush. All creatures {@condition grappled} by the drainberry bush have some of their blood taken and must attempt a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw to resist the effects of blood loss. On a failed save, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) necrotic damage and gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drainberry bush makes three attacks with its vines.

action.name: Vine
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}).

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. It takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Draining Presence
entries: When a creature starts it turn within 10 feet of the wraith, it must succeed at a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage and have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The creature dies if it this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Create Specter
entries: The wraith targets a humanoid within 10 feet of it that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently. The target's spirit rises as a {@creature specter|MM} in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. The {@creature specter|MM} is under the wraith's control. The wraith can have no more than ten {@creature specter|MM|specters} under its control at one time.

action.name: Absorb Wraith
entries: The dread wraith extends its hand toward another wraith or {@creature specter|MM} within 100 feet. The target must succeed at a {@dc 15} Wisdom save or be absorbed (a willing creature can choose to fail this save). A creature being absorbed dissolves into mist which streaks toward the wraith in a straight line. Each creature along that line must succeed at a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage. After absorbing a creature, the wraith gains the effect of {@spell haste} for 1 minute.

trait.name: Devoted to Drelev
entries: A Drelev guard has advantage on saving throws against effects that would force them to abandon their duty to Drelev.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guard makes three attacks with his longsword or longbow.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Dweomercat

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dweomercat's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The dweomercat can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The dweomercat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The dweomercat has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rake
entries: If a dweomercat hits with both claw attacks, or with one claw attack and its bite, it can make an extra claw attack as a bonus action. It has disadvantage on the attack roll for this claw attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dweomercat makes two claw attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Pouncing Spring
entries: If the dweomercat moves at least 10 feet before attacking and this attack hits, it can choose to deal an additional {@damage 1d6} piercing damage. If it chooses to forgo this extra damage, its movement after attacking does not provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|attacks of opportunity}.

reactionHeader: Whenever a dweomercat is subjected to a spell effect or is in the area of effect for a spell, as a reaction it can use one of the following reactions. The dweomercat is still affected by the spell.

reaction.name: Dweomer Leap
entries: The dweomercat teleports to an unoccupied space adjacent to the caster and makes a single melee attack.

reaction.name: Spell Link
entries: The dweomercat gains one of the following spell effects, depending on the school of the spell. If an active spell effect requires {@status concentration}, it ends if the dweomercat uses this ability to gain another {@status concentration} spell effect.

items: Abjuration: The dweomercat gains {@spell protection from energy} for 1 minute.
Conjuration: The dweomercat gains {@spell shield} for 1 round.
Divination: The dweomercat can {@spell detect evil and good} or {@spell detect thoughts} for 1 minute.
Enchantment: The dweomercat gains {@spell heroism} for 1 minute.

Evocation: The dweomercat reflects a portion of the spell's energy back at the caster, dealing a number of damage equal to the spell's level if the caster fails a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, or half as much damage if they succeed (minimum 1).
Illusion: The dweomercat gains {@spell invisibility} for 1 minute.
Necromancy: The dweomercat gains {@spell false life} for 1 minute.
Transmutation: The dweomercat gains the effect of {@spell magic weapon} on its bite and claws for 1 minute.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: {@item Longbow|PHB}, {@item arrows (20)|PHB}, {@item longsword|PHB}, {@item leather armor|PHB}, {@item explorer's pack|PHB}, {@item Alchemist's Fire (flask)|PHB|alchemist's fire} (3), and {@item woodcarver's tools|PHB}.

trait.name: Favored Enemy
entries: Ekundayo has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track giants, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

trait.name: Natural Explorer
entries: When Ekundayo makes an Intelligence or Wisdom check related to forest terrain, his proficiency bonus (+2) is doubled if he is using a skill that he's proficient in. While traveling for an hour or more in favored terrain, he gains the following benefits:

items: {@quickref Difficult terrain||3} doesn't slow his group's travel.
His group can't become lost except by magical means.
Even when he is engaged in another activity while traveling (such as foraging, navigating, or tracking), he remains alert to danger.
If he is traveling alone, he can move stealthily at a normal pace.
When he forages, he finds twice the food as normal.
While tracking other creatures, he also learns their exact number, their sizes, and how long ago they passed through the area.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used in two hands.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Ekundayo is a 6th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}). He has the following ranger spells prepared:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: {@item +1 Longbow|DMG|Longbow +1}, {@item arrows (20)|PHB}, {@item +1 longsword|DMG|longsword +1}, {@item +1 leather armor|DMG|leather armor +1}, {@item boots of elvenkind}, {@item explorer's pack|PHB}, {@item Alchemist's Fire (flask)|PHB|alchemist's fire} (3), and {@item woodcarver's tools|PHB}.

trait.name: Favored Enemy
entries: Ekundayo has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track giants and dragons, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

trait.name: Fighting Style (Archery)
entries: Ekundayo gains a +2 bonus to attack rolls he makes with ranged weapons (included in the attack).

trait.name: Natural Explorer
entries: When Ekundayo makes an Intelligence or Wisdom check related to forest or mountain terrain, his proficiency bonus (+3) is doubled if he is using a skill that he's proficient in. While traveling for an hour or more in favored terrain, he gains the following benefits:

items: {@quickref Difficult terrain||3} doesn't slow his group's travel.
His group can't become lost except by magical means.
Even when he is engaged in another activity while traveling (such as foraging, navigating, or tracking), he remains alert to danger.
If he is traveling alone, he can move stealthily at a normal pace.
When he forages, he finds twice as much food as he normally would.
While tracking other creatures, he also learns their exact number, their sizes, and how long ago they passed through the area.

trait.name: Primeval Awareness
entries: Ekundayo can use his action and expend one ranger spell slot to focus his awareness on the region around him. For 1 minute per level of the spell slot, he can sense whether the following types of creatures are present within 1 mile of him (or within up to 6 miles if he is in his favored terrain): aberrations, celestials, dragons, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead. This feature doesn't reveal the creatures' locations or number.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ekundayo makes two melee or ranged weapon attacks. Then, he can make another attack with the same weapon against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target and within range of his weapon.

action.name: Longsword +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage. or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used in two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Longbow +1
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Aura of Fear
entries: A creature that is within 10 feet of the banshee while it is conscious has disadvantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}. Creatures that are normally immune to being {@condition frightened} lose their immunity to being {@condition frightened} while within 10 feet of the banshee but do not have disadvantage on their saving throws against becoming {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Hear Heartbeat
entries: The banshee can sense the beating hearts of living creatures within 60 feet, perceiving them as if the banshee had the {@sense blindsight} ability. It cannot detect plants, oozes, or amorphous creatures with this ability, nor any living creature that lacks a heartbeat.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The banshee can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. The banshee takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the banshee fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Spectral Ripple
entries: When the banshee moves at least 10 feet during a round, it is treated as if it is lightly obscured until the beginning of its next turn.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the banshee has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Terrifying Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) necrotic damage, and the target must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. If the target is under the effects of an ongoing spell or effect that protects against being {@condition frightened} (such as {@spell heroes' feast}), treat the Terrifying Touch as a {@spell dispel magic} spell against that effect.

action.name: Immortal Anguish
entries: Creatures within 60 feet of the banshee that are able to see and hear them must make a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, a creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks for 1 minute. A creature that succeeds at a saving throw against this trait is immune for 24 hours.

action.name: Shout
entries: Creatures within 30 feet of the banshee must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) thunder damage on a failed save and becoming {@condition deafened} for 1 minute, and taking half as much damage on a success and not becoming {@condition deafened}.

action.name: Wail {@recharge}
entries: Hostile living creatures within 40 feet who can hear the banshee have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of the banshee's next turn and must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) necrotic damage and 28 ({@damage 8d6}) thunder damage and is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute; on a failure by 5 or more, the target is permanently {@condition deafened}. A target can make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns; on a success, the target is no longer {@condition frightened}. Any magical silence effect within range is treated as if the banshee had cast {@spell dispel magic}. The sound of the banshee's wail reverberates until the beginning of its next turn, and any creature coming within range is affected by these echoes as if it had been present when the banshee had wailed.

reaction.name: Vengeful Spite
entries: When an enemy within 40 feet critically hits the banshee or the banshee fails a saving throw against such an enemy's damaging effect, the banshee lashes back at its tormentor to evoke anguish and horror. The target must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) psychic damage or half as much on a successful save. A creature failing its saving throw is also {@condition stunned}. The creature can attempt a new saving throw each round at the end of its turn to end the {@condition stunned} condition, though when the stun ends, it becomes {@condition frightened} for 1 round.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The banshee moves up to its full speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Shout (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The banshee uses its shout.

legendary.name: Terrifying Touch Attack
entries: The banshee makes one terrifying touch attack.

trait.name: Blinding Sickness
entries: Creatures that take damage from the elemental's slam or surge must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or contract {@disease blinding sickness|PKB}. A creature with {@disease blinding sickness|PKB} must repeat the saving throw at the end of each long rest, gaining one level of {@condition exhaustion} on a failure or reducing its {@condition exhaustion} level from this disease by one on a success. {@condition Exhaustion} from {@disease blinding sickness|PKB} can't be removed while the disease continues. A creature that reaches three levels of {@condition exhaustion} from {@disease blinding sickness|PKB} is permanently {@condition blinded}.

trait.name: Vortex
entries: Water within a 50-foot radius around the elemental is {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for swimming non-elemental creatures.

trait.name: Water-Bound
entries: If the elemental is not touching water, it can't use reactions and it can use either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes three slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the elemental either pushes the target up to 10 feet away or pulls the target up to 10 feet toward itself.

action.name: Drench
entries: The elemental attempts to extinguish all fires within 50 feet of itself. If a fire is magical, the elemental makes a Strength saving throw with a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the fire is extinguished.

action.name: Surge {@recharge 5}
entries: The elemental quickly expands to fill the area of its vortex before retracting to its former space. Each creature within the vortex must make a {@dc 21} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) bludgeoning damage and is pushed up to 20 feet away from the elemental. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

trait.name: Vortex
entries: Water within a 50-foot radius around the elemental is {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for swimming non-elemental creatures.

trait.name: Water-Bound
entries: If the elemental is not touching water, it can't use reactions and it can use either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes three slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the elemental either pushes the target up to 10 feet away or pulls the target up to 10 feet toward itself.

action.name: Drench
entries: The elemental attempts to extinguish all fires within 20 feet of itself. If a fire is magical, the elemental makes a Strength saving throw with a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the fire is extinguished.

action.name: Surge {@recharge 5}
entries: The elemental quickly expands to fill the area of its vortex before retracting to its former space. Each creature within the vortex must make a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 22 ({@damage 5d8}) bludgeoning damage and is pushed up to 20 feet away from the elemental. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Elga is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). Elga has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Hard to Beguile
entries: Elga has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage is used in two hands to make a melee attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Engelidis is an 15th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks), and she needs only verbal components to cast her spells. Engelidis has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If Engelidis dies, she returns to life in {@dice 1d6} days and regains all her hit points. Only a {@spell wish} spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Engelidis makes two attacks with her bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The dragonfly doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Skimmersense
entries: The dragonfly can sense other creatures touching the same water, functioning as {@sense tremorsense|MM} with a range of 30 feet.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the dragonfly can't {@action grapple} another target. The dragonfly can continue to bite by transferring the {@condition grappled} target to its limbs.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The flame drake has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Smokesense
entries: The flame drake can see through smoke. Smoke does not provide concealment against the flame drake.

trait.name: Speed Surge (3/Day)
entries: The flame drake can use {@action Dash} as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The flame drake attacks twice: once with its bite and once with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fireball Breath {@recharge}
entries: The flame drake exhales a fireball to a point within 150 feet. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 40 ({@damage 9d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Eobald is a 5th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). Eobold has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Current Distress
entries: When first encountered, Eobald has 1 hit point and available spell slots as listed below{@homebrew : {@note 1st level: 1 slot, 2nd level: no slots, 3rd level: 1 slot.}|under Spellcasting}.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Evindra's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nereid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Shawl
entries: The nereid's shawl (AC 10, 6 hit points) contains part of her life force. If the shawl is destroyed, she takes {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage per hour until she dies. The nereid can craft a new shawl from water by making a {@dc 10} Wisdom check, but each attempt takes {@dice 1d4} hours to complete.

trait.name: Transparency
entries: When underwater, the nereid's body becomes transparent, effectively rendering her {@condition invisible}. She can become visible or transparent on her turn without using an action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nereid uses Beguile, then Suggestion.

action.name: Blind
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}the target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned}, the target is blind, and can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Beguile
entries: Evindra causes any creatures within 30 feet that can see her to make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks made to perceive any creature other than Evindra for 1 minute or until the target can no longer see her. The effect ends if the nereid is {@condition incapacitated} or cannot be seen. Creatures that can't be {@condition charmed} are immune to this effect. If Evindra or her allies are hostile to a creature, that creature has advantage on its saving throw.

action.name: Drowning Kiss
entries: Evindra can flood the lungs of one target within 5 feet that is willing, {@condition incapacitated}, or affected by her Beguile. She touches the target, traditionally by kissing the creature on the lips. The target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or immediately begin drowning. Drowning creatures begin suffocating. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Constitution saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Suggestion
entries: Evindra suggests a course of activity (limited to a sentence or two) and magically influences a creature she can see within 30 feet that can hear and understand her. Creatures that can't be {@condition charmed} are immune to this effect. The suggestion must be worded in such a manner as to make the course of action sound reasonable. Asking the creature to stab itself, throw itself onto a spear, immolate itself, or do some other obviously harmful act automatically fails. The target must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it pursues the course of action Evindra described to the best of its ability. The suggested course of action can continue for up to 8 hours. If the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the effect ends when the subject finishes what it was asked to do. If Evindra or any of her companions damage the target, the effect ends.

trait.name: Gnome Cunning
entries: The gnome has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The servant makes two knife melee attacks.

action.name: Knife
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 10/60 ft., one creature. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The false priestess is an 8th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). She knows the following sorcerer spells:

trait.name: Distant Spell (2/Day)
entries: When the false priestess casts a spell with a range of 5 feet or more, she can double the range of the spell. When the false priestess casts a spell with a range of touch, she can increase the range to 30 feet.

trait.name: Primal Weapon
entries: The false priestess's melee weapon attacks deal an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) damage on a successful hit. This extra damage is already factored into the false priestess's attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The false priestess makes two attacks with her glaive.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d10 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Corrosive Form
entries: A creature that touches the fen pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the fen pudding corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage. The pudding can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The fen pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage. In addition, nonmagical armor worn by the target is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

reaction.name: Split
entries: When a fen pudding that is Medium or larger is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two new fen puddings if it has at least 10 hit points. Each new pudding has hit points equal to half the original fen pudding's, rounded down. New fen puddings are one size smaller than the original fen pudding.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The behemoth's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). The behemoth can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

1: {@spell plane shift} (to or from the First World only)

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The behemoth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The behemoth regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the behemoth takes fire or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the behemoth's next turn. The behemoth dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Tongues
entries: The behemoth can understand all spoken languages and can be understood by any creature that has a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The behemoth makes two fist attacks.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 14} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The stalker's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). The stalker can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

1: {@spell plane shift} (to or from the First World only)

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The stalker has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The stalker regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the stalker takes fire or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the stalker's next turn. The stalker dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Tongues
entries: The stalker can understand all spoken languages and can be understood by any creature that has a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The stalker makes four fetch weapon attacks.

action.name: Summoned Fetch Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage. When the stalker manifests this weapon, it can choose its appearance, and can alter the damage type from slashing to bludgeoning or piercing.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Fionn's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Bound to the Mortal Night
entries: Fionn's restless spirit is bound to the night itself. He can travel anywhere he wishes, so long as it is night. During the day, he cannot travel further than thirty feet from the location he occupies as the sun rises. If he gains an effect that would normally transport him to another plane, he instead remains on the Material Plane and is {@condition stunned} until the end of his next turn.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: Fionn can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: Fionn can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. He takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if he ends his turn inside an object.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Fionn makes two attacks with his ghostly battleaxe or his withering touch. Alternately, he can make one attack with each.

action.name: Ghostly Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) necrotic damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) cold damage.

action.name: Withering Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Fionn makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Command Undead (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Fionn chooses two undead minions within 30 feet. A chosen undead uses its reaction to perform either an {@action Attack} on an enemy, or a {@action Dash} action to move to an enemy.

legendary.name: Fearsome Blizzard (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Fionn exhales a swirling blizzard of snow and ice that chills both flesh and soul. All creatures other than those with the undead type within 30 feet must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) cold damage and is {@condition frightened} of Fionn for 1 round. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and is not {@condition frightened}.

from: {@item bracers of defense|DMG|traveler's clothes of defense}

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Foras is a 19th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks), and he needs only verbal components to cast its spells. He has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Outside of Time
entries: Foras exists outside of time; he doesn't age, doesn't need food or drink to survive, and can't be affected by the {@spell haste} or {@spell slow} spells unless he chooses to be.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Foras has a {@item +2 quarterstaff|DMG|quarterstaff +2} and magical traveler's clothes (as {@item bracers of defense}).

trait.name: Unseen Sight
entries: Foras has the ability to see the truth of the world, granting them {@sense darkvision} and {@sense truesight} to a distance of 60 feet, as long as they remain in a region under Yog-Sothoth's influence.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage if used in two hands to make a melee attack.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Foras makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Accelerated
entries: Foras moves up to his speed. This movement does not provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Time Siphon (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Foras warps time around him in a 60-foot radius. Any creature that is not a construct or undead that moves into the area for the first time or ends its turn there must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become slowed (as the {@spell slow} spell) until the end of its next round. Worshippers of Yog-Sothoth are immune to this effect.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Sir Fredero has three {@item Potion of Greater Healing|DMG|potions of greater healing}.

trait.name: Stubborn Conviction
entries: Sir Fredero has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Sir Fredero makes three attacks with his longsword or longbow.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) thunder damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Sir Fredero adds 2 to his AC against one melee attack that might hit him. To do so, Sir Fredero must be able to see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw if the basilisk isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} until freed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or other magic.

A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If the basilisk sees its reflection within 30 feet of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The froghemoth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Electric Torpor
entries: Although a froghemoth is immune to damage from lightning, whenever it would otherwise take such damage it is instead slowed—it cannot use Multiattack or reactions, and its movement speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The froghemoth has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight. In addition, it can't be surprised, nor do enemies gain advantage against it for having their allies within 5 feet of the froghemoth.

trait.name: Otherworldly Vision
entries: A froghemoth's stalked eyes allow it to see in all directions at once. It cannot be {@variantrule Flanking|DMG|flanked} and can never be surprised. It also can perceive {@condition invisible} or ethereal creatures within 30 feet, and it automatically sees through all visual illusions within 30 feet.

trait.name: Prodigious Leap
entries: The froghemoth's long jump is up to 60 feet, and its high jump is up to 30 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The froghemoth makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its tentacles.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the froghemoth. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the froghemoth, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the froghemoth's turns. If the froghemoth takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the froghemoth must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the froghemoth. If the froghemoth dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this {@action grapple} ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the froghemoth can't attack with that tentacle until the {@action grapple} ends. The froghemoth has four tentacles and each can grapple only a single target. {@condition Restrained} creatures automatically take tentacle damage at the start of the froghemoth's turn.

action.name: Aquatic Ambush
entries: If the froghemoth is hidden in water and there is a creature within 40 feet that has not detected it, as an action the froghemoth can move up to 40 feet toward that creature over water and land in any combination and then make one attack against that creature with advantage on the attack roll. If the attack hits, the froghemoth can make a second attack against the same creature as a bonus action; it does not gain advantage on this attack roll.

reaction.name: Barbed Tongue
entries: When a ranged attack within 30 feet hits or misses the froghemoth, as a reaction, it can lash out with its tongue at the attacker. The target must make on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled to within 10 feet of the froghemoth, who makes a bite attack against the target.

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Gaetane is a 10th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). Gaetane has the following ranger spells known:

trait.name: Archery
entries: Gaetane gains a +2 bonus to attack rolls he makes with ranged weapons (bonus included below).

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: Gaetane has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: Gaetane can use his action to polymorph into a rat-humanoid hybrid or into a giant rat, or back into his true form, which is humanoid. His statistics, other than his AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. Gaetane reverts to its true form if he dies.

action.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: Gaetane makes two melee attacks with his bite, or three ranged attacks with his longbow.

action.name: Bite (Rat or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with {@variantrule Player Characters as Lycanthropes|MM|wererat lycanthropy}.

action.name: Longbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much poison damage on a successful one.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While Gedovius remains motionless, he is indistinguishable from an inanimate statue.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Gedovius' weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Sadistic Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage plus {@damage 1d6} psychic damage when Gedovius hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Gedovius deals an extra 17 ({@damage 5d6}) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Gedovius that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and Gedovius doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Gedovius makes four attacks: one with his bite, one with gore, and two with his claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:1211 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The ghostly guard can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when they are on the First World, and vice versa.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the ghostly guard is subjected to an effect that allows them to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the ghostly guard instead takes no damage if they succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if they fail.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ghostly guard can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. They take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if they end their turn inside an object.

trait.name: Shame
entries: A ghostly guard has disadvantage with all rolls made against elves or those whom it believes are worshippers of Calistria. A character who understands the nature of this shame can attempt to forgive a ghostly guard (requiring an action by the forgiving creature) by speaking to it in a language it understands. The ghostly guard must attempt a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, the ghostly guard has disadvantage with all rolls until the end of its next turn. If it rolls a natural 1 on this saving throw, the ghostly guard fades away as it comes to terms with its death and its soul is released into the afterlife.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ghostly guard makes two melee attacks with their withering touch.

action.name: Withering Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}31 ({@damage 7d6 + 7}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The ghostly guard enters the Ethereal Plane from the First World, or vice versa. They are visible on the First World while they are in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet they can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Horrifying Visage
entries: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the ghostly guard that can see them must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target also ages {@dice 1d4  10} years. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition frightened} condition on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the ghostly guard's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours. The aging effect can be reversed with a {@spell greater restoration} spell, but only within 24 hours of it occurring.

action.name: Possession {@recharge}
entries: One humanoid that the ghostly guard can see within 5 feet of him must succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or be possessed by them; the ghostly guard then disappears, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and loses control of its body. The ghostly guard now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The ghostly guard can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and they retain their alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}. They otherwise use the possessed target's statistics, but don't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the ghostly guard ends it as a bonus action, or the ghost is turned or forced out by an effect like the {@spell dispel evil and good} spell. When the possession ends, the ghostly guard reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to the ghostly guard's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

trait.name: Burn Alive
entries: As a bonus action, the statue roasts a creature it has {@condition grappled} in the fires that burn inside its hollow spheres. The target takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The statue makes two attacks.

action.name: Sphere
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity save or be {@condition grappled} in one of the statues hollow spheres (escape {@dc 14}). The statue can hold up to 12 creatures in this way.

action.name: Flaming Coal
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 80/160 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant flytrap makes four bite attacks (one for each mouth).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this {@action grapple} ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the giant flytrap can't bite another target with this mouth.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The giant flytrap makes one bite attack against a creature it is {@action grapple|PHB|grappling}. If the attack hits, that creature takes the bite's damage and is swallowed, and the {@action grapple} ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover from attacks and other effects outside the giant flytrap, and it takes 9 ({@dice 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the giant flytrap's turns.

If the giant flytrap takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the creature inside it, the giant flytrap must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the giant flytrap. If the giant flytrap dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the flytrap's corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Malleable
entries: The giant slug's body is very malleable, allowing it to fit into narrow areas with ease. The slug can move through any space large enough for a Large creature without squeezing, and it can squeeze through any space large enough for a Medium creature.

trait.name: Susceptible to Salt
entries: A handful of salt burns the giant slug as if it were a flask of acid, causing {@damage 2d6} damage per use. Larger quantities of salt can cause increasing damage, as determined by the GM.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 6d6 + 7}) piercing damage plus 24 ({@damage 7d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Spit Acid
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}35 ({@damage 10d6}) acid damage.

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The giant tick has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by it.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The giant tick has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 11}). If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be infected with a disease. While infected, the target can't regain hit points except by magical means. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 3 ({@dice 1d6}) on a failure. The disease is cured on a success. The target dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the disease is cured.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Trapdoor Lunge
entries: If the spider surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage from the attack. The spider can then move up to its speed.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The giant vulture has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Projectile Vomit (Recharge short rest)
entries: The giant vulture vomits up the awful contents of its stomach on a creature within 10 feet. The creature must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and is not {@condition poisoned} on a successful save. The {@condition poisoned} creature can make a {@dc 15} Constitution save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a living creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw or gain disadvantage on all Strength-based checks for the next 24 hours. The disease is cured on a success.

action.name: Talon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant whiptail centipede makes two attacks, one with its bite and one with its tail slap.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for one hour.

action.name: Tail Slap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft. one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The wolverine has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the wolverine moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed at a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the wolverine can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Wolverine Rage
entries: The wolverine can enter a rage as a bonus action.
