While raging, the wolverine has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, it deals an additional 2 damage with each attack, and it gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons. The rage lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if the wolverine drops to 0 hit points or if its turn ends and it hasn't either attacked a hostile creature or taken damage since its last turn.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Goblin Pox
entries: A creature exposed to {@disease goblin pox|PKB} must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become afflicted with {@disease goblin pox|PKB}. On a successful saving throw, it is immune to {@disease goblin pox|PKB} for 24 hours. A creature with {@disease goblin pox|PKB} is {@condition poisoned} and must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failed save, the creature can use either an action or a bonus action on its turns, but not both. The creature can then repeat the saving throw after each long rest, ending the effects on itself on a success. Goblins and goblin dogs are immune to {@disease goblin pox|PKB}.

trait.name: Irritating Dander
entries: A creature that hits a goblin bat-dog with an unarmed attack, tries to {@action grapple} it, or otherwise touches it is exposed to {@disease goblin pox|PKB}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The goblin bat-dog has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing and smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dander Dusting (Recharge after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The goblin bat-dog flaps its wings furiously, causing a noxious cloud of dander to fill the air in a 5-foot radius around it. All creatures in the area of effect are exposed to {@disease goblin pox|PKB}, and any creature other than a goblin, {@creature goblin dog|PKB}, or goblin bat-dog must succeed at a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the beginning of the goblin bat-dog's next turn.

action.name: Horsechopper
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Goblin Scuttle
entries: When a nonhostile creature the goblin can see ends its movement within 5 feet of the goblin, the goblin moves up to 5 feet. The goblin doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} with this movement.

trait.name: Goblin Pox
entries: A creature exposed to {@disease goblin pox|PKB} must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or become afflicted with {@disease goblin pox|PKB}. On a successful saving throw, it is immune to {@disease goblin pox|PKB} for 24 hours.

A creature with {@disease goblin pox|PKB} is {@condition poisoned} and must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failed save, the creature can use either an action or a bonus action on its turns, but not both. The creature can then repeat the saving throw after each long rest, ending the effects on itself on a success. Goblins and goblin dogs are immune to {@disease goblin pox|PKB}.

trait.name: Irritating Dander
entries: A creature that touches the goblin dog or hits the goblin dog with an unarmed strike is exposed to {@disease goblin pox|PKB}.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The goblin dog has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Scratch
entries: The goblin dog vigorously scratches itself, exposing all creatures within 5 feet of it to {@disease goblin pox|PKB}.

reaction.name: Juke
entries: When the goblin dog is given an order by a creature mounted to it, the goblin dog moves up to 5 feet. The goblin dog doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} with this movement.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The goblin pyro is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following spells prepared:

action.name: Torch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 1 fire damage.

reaction.name: Goblin Scuttle
entries: When a nonhostile creature the goblin can see ends its movement within 5 feet of the goblin, the goblin moves up to 5 feet. The goblin doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} with this movement.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The war chanter is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following spells prepared:

action.name: Dogslicer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Goblin Song
entries: The war chanter sings annoying goblin songs. Each creature within 60 feet of the war chanter that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become distracted for 1 minute. Distracted creatures have disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

reaction.name: Goblin Scuttle
entries: When a nonhostile creature the goblin can see ends its movement within 5 feet of the goblin, the goblin moves up to 5 feet. The goblin doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} with this movement.

trait.name: Carry Off Prey
entries: The gogiteth can move at its full speed while {@action grapple|PHB|grappling} a creature, moving the creature with it.

trait.name: Relentless Hunter
entries: The gogiteth has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks made to track creatures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gogiteth makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its legs.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this {@action grapple} ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and takes 24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) piercing damage at the start of each of the gogiteth's turns, and the gogiteth can't bite another target.

action.name: Leg
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Skittering Assault
entries: The gogiteth moves up to its speed three times, making a leg attack against a different creature within reach each time it moves.

reaction.name: Skittering Reposition
entries: When a creature the gogiteth can see moves within 10 feet of its space, the gogiteth can move up to 10 feet. The gogiteth doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} with this movement.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Grabbles' innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 11}). {@homebrew Grabbles|The mite} can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Hatred
entries: Grabbles doubles his proficiency bonus on attack rolls against humanoid creatures of the dwarf or gnome subtype due to special training against these hated foes.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: Grabbles has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Self-Loathing
entries: Grabbles's self-loathing makes him easy to influence. He has disadvantage on saving throws and ability checks to resist any Charisma-based skills or being {@condition charmed}.

trait.name: Vermin Keeper
entries: Through sounds and gestures, Grabbles can communicate simple ideas with arthropods. The knowledge and awareness of these arthropods is limited by their intelligence, but at minimum, they can provide information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever they can perceive or have perceived within the past day. Grabbles can ask for small favors from the arthropods and has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) checks when communicating with them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Grabbles makes three trident attacks.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

reaction.name: Vengeful
entries: When Grabbles is hit by an attack or fails a saving throw, he makes an attack against the creature that harmed him.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The graveknight's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). The graveknight can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Graveknight's Curse
entries: A living creature that dons the graveknight's armor must succeed on a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw or be afflicted with the graveknight's curse. Cursed creatures cannot remove the graveknight's armor and must repeat the saving throw at the end of each long rest. On a second failed save, the creature has disadvantage on death saving throws. On a third failed save, the creature's speed is halved. On a fourth failed save, the creature dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight. A successful saving throw lifts the curse, and the armor falls off. The creature is subject to the curse if it dons the armor again.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If a graveknight is destroyed, its armor regrows its body in {@dice 1d10} days. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts. A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor with a {@spell disintegrate} spell, transporting it to the Positive Energy Plane, or by throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

trait.name: Ruinous Energy
entries: The graveknight presented here is infused with cold, but others can be infused with acid, {@homebrew lightning|electricity}, or fire. A graveknight is immune to damage type of its ruinous energy, and its attacks and devastating blast deal additional damage of this energy type.

trait.name: Sacrilegious Aura
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of the graveknight uses a spell or ability that magically restores hit points, the creature must make a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the creature's spell or ability fails and has no effect.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The graveknight makes two greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Devastating Blast {@recharge}
entries: The graveknight unleashes a 30-foot cone of energy. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The blast's damage is the same type as its ruinous energy, cold, for this graveknight.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The graveknight adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the graveknight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

items.name: Ruinous Energy
entries: The graveknight presented here is infused with {{damageType}}. A graveknight is immune to damage type of its ruinous energy, and its attacks and devastating blast deal additional damage of this energy type.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The graveknight makes two greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) {{damageType}} damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) {{damageType}} damage.

action.name: Devastating Blast {@recharge}
entries: The graveknight unleashes a 30-foot cone of energy. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) {{damageType}} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The barghest's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). A barghest can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The barghest can use its action to polymorph into a {@creature goblin} or a {@creature wolf}, or back into its true form. While the barghest is a {@creature goblin} it loses its bite and claw attacks, it becomes Small, its move speed becomes 30 feet, and it gains the Nimble Escape ability. When the barghest is a {@creature wolf}, its speed changes to 40 feet and it gains the Knockdown ability.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: While in its {@creature goblin} form, the barghest can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} actions as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Knockdown
entries: While in its {@creature wolf} form, if the barghest hits with a bite attack, the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The barghest has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Mutation
entries: The process of consuming corpses to evolve into a greater barghest results in odd and unpredictable physiological changes. In Nargloom's case, this mutation is the formation of a pair of bat wings that grant him a fly speed of 30 feet while in his true form. (Unlike most greater barghests, Nargloom also possesses a third eye in his forehead, but this doesn't grant him any additional abilities of note.)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The barghest makes three attacks, one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The grig's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). The grig can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Leaper
entries: The grig has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d3 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, 40/160 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Fiddle
entries: The grig rubs its legs together, creating a surprisingly pleasant tune that sounds like it's played on a fiddle. Creatures within 20 feet of the grig must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be compelled to dance in place. A dancing creature must use all its movement to dance without leaving its space and has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws and attack rolls. While the target is affected by this spell, other creatures have advantage on attack rolls against it. As an action, a dancing creature makes a Wisdom saving throw to regain control of itself. On a successful save, the effect ends. Creatures that can't be {@condition charmed} are immune to this effect.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Grigori is an 8th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). Grigori knows the following bard spells:

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Grigori deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Grigori that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and Grigori doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Command Plants
entries: The grimstalker can magically command any plant within 30 feet of him, using a limited telepathy. Plants never attack the grimstalker unless compelled.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The grimstalker makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Blinded
entries: Gromog is {@condition blinded|PHB|blind}.

trait.name: Itchy
entries: Gromog's lice cause him to scratch incessantly, distracting him from what is going on. He stops mid-conversation to focus on ridding himself of the pests, and even in the throws of combat, he must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw or only be able to use his action to scratch his irritated skin.

action.name: Ogre Hook
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Gurija is a 5th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). She can cast the following sorcerer spells:

spells: {@spell fire bolt|PHB|electric arc} (as firebolt but damage is changed to {@dice 2d10} lightning)

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: Gurija has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Gurija regains 10 hit points at the start of her turn. If she takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of her next turn. Gurija dies only if she starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Gurija makes three attacks: one with her bite and two with her shocking claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shocking Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage and 4 ({@damage 1d8}) lightning damage.

reaction.name: Resist Energy (3/Day)
entries: When Gurija is dealt damage from a type of energy, she redirects a portion of that energy away from herself. Gurija gains resistance to the energy type that triggered her reaction, and on her next successful melee weapon attack, she deals 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage of the triggering type.

reaction.name: Sudden Stormburst
entries: When an ally within 60 feet takes acid or fire damage, Gurija summons a torrential but localized rainstorm around the ally. This rainstorm washes away acid and douses fire, immediately ending any ongoing acid or fire damage.

trait.name: Erosion Aura
entries: Any creature within 120 feet of the guthallath loses all of its damage resistances, and objects in the aura take double damage. If a creature starts its turn within the guthallath's aura, it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The guthallath has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The guthallath's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the guthallath fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guthallath makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 23}) and is {@condition restrained} until the {@action grapple} ends. The guthallath has two hands, each of which can only {@action grapple} one target.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 4d10 + 9}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}

action.name: Deadly Throw
entries: One Huge or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by the guthallath is thrown up to 50 feet in any direction and is knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Annihilation Beams {@recharge 5}
entries: The guthallath shoots beams from its eyes in a 120-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 45 ({@damage 10d8}) force damage. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a pile of fine gray dust.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The guthallath makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The guthallath makes a stomp attack.

legendary.name: Trample (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The guthallath moves up to 40 feet in a straight line and can move through the spaces of Huge or smaller creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. The guthallath makes one stomp attack against each creature and object as it moves through their space. On a hit, a creature must also succeed on a {@dc 23} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Defender Weapon
entries: Drelev's {@item defender|DMG|longsword is a magical weapon +3}. The first time he attacks with the sword on each of his turns, Drelev can transfer some or all of the sword's bonus to his Armor Class, instead of using the bonus on any attacks that turn. The adjusted bonuses remain in effect until the start of his next turn, although Drelev must hold the sword to gain a bonus to AC from it. The bonus is not included in Drelev's Armor Class or Defender Longsword entries.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Drelev deals an extra {@dice 6d6} (21) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Drelev that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and Drelev doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Hannis Drelev makes three attacks.

action.name: Defender Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Disarming Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}the target must make a {@dc 17} Strength check or drop one held item of Drelev's choice.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20 ft./60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150 ft./600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Brave
entries: Hargulka has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: Hargulka has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Hargulka regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If he takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of Hargulka's next turn. Hargulka dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Hargulka makes three melee attacks, two with his morningstar and one with his bite, or two with his claws and one with his bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

resist.note: from non-magical weapons (due to the resilient hide armor)

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, the giant deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the giant that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the giant doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes a battleaxe and hatchet attack.

action.name: Battleaxe +2
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hatchet +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}37 ({@damage 8d6 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Thrown Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Wide Swing {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant swings its battleaxe in a circle around itself, and every creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) slashing damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Twin Butchery (Only a target under the effects of Menace Prey)
entries: So long as the giant is wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand and hits his menaced prey twice in the same round it deals an additional {@damage 2d6} damage and the giant has advantage on its next attack roll against the target.

action.name: Menace Prey
entries: The giant designates up to two creatures it can see and hear, or one they're tracking, as their prey. The target becomes marked. While marked, the giant gains a +2 bonus to Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track the prey. If the giant scores a critical hit against the marked target they are automatically {@condition frightened} of the giant for one minute. Targets are marked for up to 24 hours, or until the giant uses this ability again.

reaction.name: Catch Rock
entries: The giant can attempt to catch a rock thrown at a target that is within 10 feet of itself. The giant makes a Dexterity saving throw against the attack roll of the attacking creature. If it succeeds, the giant catches the rock and the intended target takes no damage.

trait.name: Knockback
entries: When the giant hits a foe with a melee attack, the giant can use a bonus action to make the target roll a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pushed back 10 feet.

trait.name: Brutality
entries: One per round, when the giant hits a target with a weapon attack, it can deal 4 ({@damage 1d8}) additional damage of the same type as the weapon.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Each giant carries a Huge {@item +1 greatclub|DMG|greatclub +1}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two greatclub attacks.

action.name: Greatclub +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Thrown Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If Hillstomper moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, Hillstomper can make a stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Hillstomper makes two attacks: one with its gore and one with its stomp.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d8 + 9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d10 + 9}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Perfect Aim
entries: The first time the hobgoblin hits with a crossbow attack in a round, they deal an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the hobgoblin can deal an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the hobgoblin that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hobgoblin makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) slashing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hodag makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws or tail slap.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Slap
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Hooktongue can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Inexorable
entries: Hooktongue ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Hooktongue makes two attacks, one with its jaws and one with its tongue.

action.name: Jaws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d12 + 5}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until the {@action grapple} ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and Hooktongue can't use a jaws attack on another target.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Venom Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: Hooktongue sprays venom from his throat in an 80-foot line. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Swallow
entries: Hooktongue makes one jaws attack against a Medium or smaller target it is {@action grapple|PHB|grappling}. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the {@action grapple} ends. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside Hooktongue, and it takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) acid damage at the start of each of Hooktongue's turns. Hooktongue can have only one creature swallowed at a time.

If Hooktongue takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, Hooktongue must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of Hooktongue. If Hooktongue dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The hydra has twelve heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.
Whenever the hydra takes 25 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies.

At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hydra attacks with as many bite attacks as it has heads, with a maximum of twelve.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Cunning
entries: Horagnamon can use simple items as tools, such as poking a stick into nooks and crannies to tease out a piece of food. He's also quite adept at stealing objects. He can use {@skill Sleight of Hand} to accomplish simple tasks, or to steal objects that weigh 1 pound or less, which he can carry in his beak or talons.

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: If Horagnamon dies, he explodes into a burst of feathers and seething black tendrils of smoke and energy. Each creature within 15 feet of him must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature that fails its save by 5 or more gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: Horagnamon has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Horagnamon makes three beak attacks.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hunter is a 15th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). They know the following ranger spells:
footerEntries: *The hunter casts this spell on themself before combat if possible.

trait.name: Favored Enemy:
entries: Beasts and Any Two Humanoids. The hunter gains advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks to search for their favored enemies and on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track them.

trait.name: Forest Walker
entries: The hunter ignores the effects of {@quickref difficult terrain||3} from a forest environment. They can sneak through underbrush without a {@skill Stealth} check as long as the hunter moves no more than 5 feet at a time and is not within 10 feet of an enemy at any point during their movement.

trait.name: Precision Edge
entries: The first time the hunter hits their favored enemy in a round, they deal an additional 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hunter makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Ilora is a 16th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). Ilora has the following ranger spells known:

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Ilora is subjected to an effect that allows her to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, Ilora instead takes no damage if she succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if she fails.

trait.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: Using a shortsword in each hand, Ilora can make one attack as a bonus action, still adding her ability modifier to the damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ilora makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Illthuliak is an 18th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Illthuliak can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Illthuliak fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Scent
entries: Illthuliak can pinpoint, by scent, the location of a creature within 30 feet of her.

trait.name: Speak with Reptiles
entries: Illthuliak can communicate with reptiles as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Swamp Stride
entries: Illthuliak ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3} that is comprised of swampy areas.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Illthuliak can use her Frightful Presence. She then makes three attacks: one with her bite and two with her claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage. The acid damage persists for 1 round as the target takes another 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage at the start of its next turn.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of Illthuliak's choice that is within 120 feet of her and aware of her must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune Illthuliak's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Corrupt Water (1/Day)
entries: Illthuliak can stagnate 10 cubic feet of still water within 120 feet of her, making it foul and unable to support water-breathing life. The ability spoils liquids containing water. The owner of liquid-based magic items (such as potions) and items in its possession must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving or have its liquid ruined.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: Illthuliak uses one of the following breath weapons:

items.name: Corrosive Acid Breath
entries: Illthuliak exhales acid in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 77 ({@damage 22d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the saving throw by 5 or more also has its acid resistance reduced by one level of protection for 1 minute—immune becomes resistance, resistance becomes normal, and normal becomes vulnerable.

items.name: Acid Pool
entries: Illthuliak can use her breath weapon to create an acid pool. This acid pool has a radius of 50 feet. When an acid pool is created, anyone inside its area takes 70 ({@damage 20d6}) acid damage on a failed {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, or half as much on a success. The pool remains for 5 rounds and deals half the amount of damage from the previous round ({@dice 10d6}, {@dice 5d6}, {@dice 2d6}, {@dice 1d6}) and then becomes inert. A creature that ends its turn in the affected area must repeat the saving throw and takes the appropriate damage. If formed on water, the pool floats and deals damage to anything on the surface.

reaction.name: Tail Slam
entries: When a creature enters or moves within Illthuliak's reach, she can make an {@action opportunity attack} with her tail against the triggering creature.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Illthuliak makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Gore
entries: Illthuliak makes a horn attack.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: Illthuliak makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Illthuliak beats her wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw or take 15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. She can then fly up to half her flying speed.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Stroon is a 12th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Stroon wields a {@item staff of fire}.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60, one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Instant Dispel (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: When Stroon fails a saving throw against a spell and has a 3rd-level or higher spell slot available, he can cast {@spell dispel magic} on himself.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The mandragora regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the mandragora takes fire or thunder damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the mandragora's next turn. The mandragora dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Vulnerable to Supernatural Darkness
entries: In areas of magical darkness (such as those created by the {@spell darkness} spell), the mandragora is slowed, as the {@spell slow} spell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The immense mandragora makes three melee attacks: one with its bite and two with its vine whips.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 5d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Vine Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 5d6 + 6}) slashing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned}. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Shriek (Recharge after Long Rest)
entries: The mandragora can give voice to an unsettling shriek. All creatures within 30 feet of the mandragora must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom save or become {@condition stunned} for {@dice 1d4} rounds. Each creature in that area must also make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 52 ({@damage 15d6}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: Irahkatu has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell or sight.

trait.name: Voice Imitation
entries: Irahkatu can mimic the sounds of a person in distress by making a Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check to lie. Irahkatu has advantage on this check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Irahkatu makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its claws, and one with its tail claw. If Irahkatu has a Medium or smaller creature {@condition grappled} with its tail claw, it replaces that attack with Disfigure.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) poison damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) slashing damage. If the target is Medium sized or smaller it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}) and it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be pulled 5 feet toward Irahkatu, or knocked {@condition prone} if already adjacent to Irahkatu.

action.name: Disfigure
entries: Irahkatu mauls a Medium or smaller creature it has {@condition grappled} with its tail claw. The target must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the {@condition grappled} creature takes 24 ({@damage 7d6}) slashing damage and has disadvantage on Dexterity-based ability checks, saving throws, and attacks for the next 24 hours. If the creature failed its saving throw by 5 or more, it is {@condition blinded} for the next 24 hours, or until it has fully healed. On a successful saving throw, the {@condition grappled} creature takes half the damage and is subjected to no other effect.

action.name: Whirlwind of Claws {@recharge 5}
entries: Irahkatu makes a claw attack against each creature of its choice within 5 feet of it.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The irlgaunt's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}). The irlgaunt can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Stone Step
entries: The irlgaunt ignores {@quickref difficult terrain||3} composed of rocks and stone.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The irlgaunt makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its stomps.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Regurgitate Gastrolith {@recharge 5}
entries: The irlgaunt violently regurgitates a melon-sized clot infused with digestive enzymes at a point it can see within 30 feet of it. Each creature within 20 feet of that point must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw as the clot explodes on impact, taking 21 ({@dice 6d6}) piercing and 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The fetch's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The fetch can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

1: {@spell plane shift} (to or from the First World only)

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The fetch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The fetch regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the fetch takes fire or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the fetch's next turn. The fetch dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Tongues
entries: The fetch can understand all spoken languages and can be understood by any creature that has a language.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Irovetti's fetch makes three attacks with its fetch weapon.

action.name: Summoned Fetch Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. When Irovetti's fetch summons his fetch weapon, he always makes it appear as the unique ranseur the living {@creature Castruccio Irovetti|PKB|Irovetti} wielded.

trait.name: Jaws That Bite
entries: The jabberwock's bite attack scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the jabberwock fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The jabberwock has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Planar Acclimation
entries: The jabberwock treats the plane it is currently on as its native plane.

trait.name: Vorpal Fear
entries: If the jabberwock takes damage from a {@item vorpal sword}, it becomes {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Whiffling
entries: The jabberwock can use a bonus action when it flies or makes a wing attack during its turn, causing severe winds in a 30-foot radius around it. These winds move outward from the jabberwock and last until the start of its next turn. All other creatures besides the jabberwock within the area of effect move as if in {@quickref difficult terrain||3} and must succeed at a {@dc 24} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check to move toward the jabberwock.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jabberwock uses Manxome Foe, then makes one bite attack and two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d10 + 10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d6 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Burble {@recharge 5}
entries: The jabberwock creates a blast of strange noises and shouted nonsense in the various languages it knows (and invariably some languages it doesn't know), creating one of the following effects.

items.name: Burble (Maddening)
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the jabberwock must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or be subjected to the effects of {@spell confusion} for 1 minute.

items.name: Burble (Thundering)
entries: Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 87 ({@damage 25d6}) thunder damage, is {@condition stunned} until the end of the jabberwock's next turn, and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. A creature that succeeds takes half as much damage and does not become {@condition deafened} and {@condition stunned}.

action.name: Eyes of Flame
entries: {@atk r} {@hit 14} to hit, range 60/120 ft., two targets within 30 feet of each other. {@h}56 ({@damage 16d6}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Manxome Foe
entries: The presence of a jabberwock is terrifying to its enemies. Each creature of the jabberwock's choice that is within 120 feet of the jabberwock and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the jabberwock's Manxome Foe for the next 24 hours.

reaction.name: Claws That Catch
entries: If a creature within 10 feet of the jabberwock takes the {@action Use an Object} action, moves from its square, or makes a ranged attack, the jabberwock can make a claw attack against the creature. If the attack hits, the target is {@condition incapacitated} and unable to move until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The jabberwock makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Eyes of Flame (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The jabberwock makes an Eyes of Flame attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The jabberwock beats its wings. Each creature within 20 feet of the jabberwock must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or take 24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The jabberwock can then fly up to half its flying speed.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Jaggedbriar hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

3e: {@spell alter self} (including the form of a Medium humanoid)

trait.name: Covens
entries: A Jaggedbriar hag that is part of a coven has a challenge rating of 9 (5,000 XP).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Jaggedbriar hag makes three attacks: one with her bite and two with her claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}).

action.name: Brutal Rend
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 9d6 + 5}) slashing damage and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until the {@action grapple} ends, the target takes 36 ({@damage 9d6 + 5}) slashing damage at the start of each of the Jaggedbriar hag's turns. The Jaggedbriar hag can't make attacks while {@action grapple|PHB|grappling} a creature in this way.

trait.name: Aldori Duelist
entries: Jamandi has advantage on {@action opportunity attack} rolls.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Jamandi has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put her to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Jamandi makes three melee attacks with her Aldori dueling sword.

action.name: Aldori Dueling Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) damage. On a critical hit against a Large or smaller creature who is holding a weapon, the creature also must make a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or the weapon they're holding is knocked from their hand and drops to their feet.

reaction.name: Unnerving Prowess (3/Day)
entries: If Jamandi is critically hit, she can choose to instead take damage as if the critical hit was a regular hit.

trait.name: Distracting Yips
entries: As long as Jewel is fighting, she unleashes a torrent of grating, high-pitched yips. At the start of its turn, any creature other than {@creature Pavetta Stroon-Drelev|PKB|Pavetta} within 20 feet of Jewel must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or gain disadvantage on {@skill Perception} checks and Constitution saving throws made to concentrate.

trait.name: Return to Pavetta
entries: If Jewel ends her turn in a square adjacent to {@creature Pavetta Stroon-Drelev|PKB|Pavetta}, and {@creature Pavetta Stroon-Drelev|PKB|Pavetta} has a hand free, Jewel can leap up into {@creature Pavetta Stroon-Drelev|PKB|Pavetta's} clutches as a bonus action.

action.name: Ankle Bite
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 piercing damage, plus the target must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw to avoid becoming distracted by the furious ankle biting. A distracted foe gains disadvantage on all checks until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The ghost can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ghost can make three ghostly hand attacks.

action.name: Ghostly Hand
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Telekinetic Assault {@recharge}
entries: The ghost turns furniture or any loose objects into projectiles that form a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The ghost enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Horrifying Visage
entries: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the ghost that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target also ages {@dice 1d4  10} years. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition frightened} condition on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this ghost's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours. The aging effect can be reversed with a {@spell greater restoration} spell, but only within 24 hours of it occurring.

reaction.name: Frightful Moan
entries: In response to being damaged in combat, Jin releases a frightful moan, provided that he isn't in sunlight. This moan has no effect on constructs and undead. All other creatures within 30 feet of him that can hear him must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition frightened} for 1 minute.

trait.name: Head Regrowth
entries: If the jotund troll has one of its nine heads severed, such as by a {@item vorpal sword}, it is able to regrow the head during the troll's regeneration. After the troll regains hit points, it makes a Constitution check; on a result of 25 or lower, one missing head is fully restored, while two missing heads are restored on a result of 26 or higher. If a jotund troll's last head is severed, the troll dies immediately.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The jotund troll regains 40 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The jotund troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the jotund troll fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jotund troll makes one bite attack and two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Cacophonous Roar {@recharge 5}
entries: The jotund troll emits a cacophonous roar from all its heads, exerting a mystical power that distorts the listener's mind. Each creature within 100 feet that is not a giant and can hear it must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save the creature is {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Ravenous Jaws {@recharge}
entries: The jotund troll makes a bite attack with each of its heads. Each attack must be directed at a different target within 10 feet of the troll.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Jubilost is a 1st-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: {@item Dagger|PHB}, {@item light crossbow|PHB}, {@item Crossbow Bolt|PHB|crossbow bolts} (10), {@item Alchemist's Fire (flask)|PHB|alchemist's fire} (2), {@item potion of healing}, {@item scholar's pack|PHB}, {@item Antitoxin (vial)|PHB|antitoxin}, {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB}, {@item traveler's clothes|PHB}.

trait.name: Artificer's Lore
entries: Whenever Jubilost makes an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to magic items, alchemical objects, or technological devices, he can add twice his proficiency bonus (+2).

trait.name: Gnome Cunning
entries: Jubilost has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

trait.name: Tinker
entries: Jubilost has proficiency with artisan's tools ({@item tinker's tools|PHB}). Using those tools, he can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless he spends 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when he uses his action to dismantle it; at that time, he can reclaim the materials used to create it. He can have up to three such devices active at a time. When you create a device, choose one of the following options:

items: Clockwork Toy: This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of his turns in a random direction. It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents.
Fire Starter: The device produces a miniature flame, which he can use to light a candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires his action.
Music Box: When this music box is opened, it plays a single song at a moderate volume. The box stops playing when it reaches the song's end or when it is closed.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Alchemist's Fire
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 20 ft., one target. {@h}The target takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a {@dc 10} Dexterity check to attempt to extinguish the flames.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Jubilost is a 4th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: {@item Dagger|PHB}, {@item light crossbow|PHB}, {@item crossbow bolt|PHB|crossbow bolts} (10), {@item Acid (vial)|PHB|acid flasks} (4), {@item Alchemist's Fire (flask)|PHB|alchemist's fire} (4), {@item potion of healing|DMG|potions of healing} (2), {@item scholar's pack|PHB}, {@item Antitoxin (vial)|PHB|antitoxin}, {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB}, {@item thieves' tools|PHB}, {@item traveler's clothes|PHB}.

trait.name: Arcane Recovery (1/Day)
entries: When he finishes a short rest, Jubilost chooses expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than two levels.

trait.name: Artificer's Lore
entries: Whenever Jubilost makes an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check related to magic items, alchemical objects, or technological devices, he can add twice his proficiency bonus (+3).

trait.name: Bomb Thrower
entries: Jubilost possesses the {@feat Bomb Thrower|PKB} feat {@homebrew |(page 196)}.

trait.name: Cunning Action. Cunning Action
entries: On each of his turns, Jubilost can use a bonus action to take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object} actions; to make a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check; or to use his {@item thieves' tools|PHB} to disarm a trap or open a lock.

trait.name: Gnome Cunning
entries: Jubilost has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

trait.name: Savant
entries: The gold and time Jubilost must spend to copy a transmutation spell into his spellbook is halved.

trait.name: Second-Story Work
entries: Climbing does not cost Jubilost extra movement. When he makes a running jump, the distance he covers increases by a number of feet equal to his Dexterity modifier (+3).

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Jubilost deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of him that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and Jubilost doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Tinker
entries: Jubilost has proficiency with artisan's tools ({@item tinker's tools|PHB}). Using those tools, he can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless he spends 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when he uses his action to dismantle it; at that time, he can reclaim the materials used to create it. He can have up to three such devices active at a time. When you create a device, choose one of the following options:

items: Clockwork Toy: This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of his turns in a random direction. It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents.
Fire Starter: The device produces a miniature flame, which he can use to light a candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires his action.
Music Box: When this music box is opened, it plays a single song at a moderate volume. The box stops playing when it reaches the song's end or when it is closed.

trait.name: Transmutation
entries: By spending 10 minutes, Jubilost can transform 1 cubic foot of an item made of wood, non-precious stone, iron, copper, or silver entirely into another one of those substances. After one hour, or if he loses {@status concentration} (as a spell), all the transmuted material reverts to its natural material.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Acid Flask
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 20 ft., one target. {@h}The target takes 10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) acid damage. On a hit, Jubilost can attempt a secondary hit against a target in range and within 5 feet of the original target (see {@feat Bomb Thrower|PKB}, below), inflicting 3 acid damage on a hit.

action.name: Alchemist's Fire
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 20 ft., one target. {@h}The target takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a {@dc 14} Dexterity check to attempt to extinguish the flames.

trait.name: Wounded Arm
entries: Jurgrindor's left arm has been wounded severely during a previous fight. At the end of each of his turns, Jurgrindor must succeed at a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or the wound begins to bleed again, dealing 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage to him. His wound prevents him from throwing rocks.

trait.name: Hit Points
entries: {@note Jurgrindor has 25 Hit Points remaining when first encountered.}

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Chill Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: Jurgrindor exhales a 15-foot cone of moisture that freezes. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save is also {@condition grappled} in ice (escape {@dc 13}), and while {@condition grappled} in this way, the creature is {@condition restrained} and takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage at the end of each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Kargstaad makes four attacks—one with each hand.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 14} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Chill Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: Kargstaad exhales a 15-foot cone of moisture that freezes. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 49 ({@damage 14d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save is also {@condition grappled} in ice (escape {@dc 16}), and while {@condition grappled} in this way, the creature is {@condition restrained} and takes 49 ({@damage 14d6}) cold damage at the end of each of its turns.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The giant can move across icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, {@quickref difficult terrain||3} composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

trait.name: Giant's Rage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the giant can enter a rage at the start of its turn. The rage lasts for 1 minute or until the giant is {@condition incapacitated}. While raging, the giant gains the following benefits:

items: The giant has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
When it makes a melee weapon attack, the giant gains a +4 bonus to the damage roll.
The giant has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The giant regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn. If the giant takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The giant dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes two attacks with its greataxe.

action.name: Greataxe of Striking +2
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 3d12 + 9}) slashing damage, or 32 ({@damage 3d12 + 13}) slashing damage while raging. The greataxe has {@dice 1d10} charges (minimum of 3) at the start of the encounter. When the giant hits with a melee attack, it can expend up to 3 of its charges. For each charge it expends, the target takes an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage. The greataxe otherwise functions as a {@item staff of striking|DMG} but is sized for a Huge giant.

action.name: Wide Swing {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant swings its battle axe in a circle around itself, Every creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 28 ({@damage 3d12 + 9}) slashing damage, or 32 ({@damage 3d12 + 13}) slashing damage if the giant is raging, and the target is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. The giant can expend charges from its greataxe of striking to increase this damage and rage bonuses also apply.

action.name: Chill Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The giant exhales a 15-foot cone of moisture that freezes. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save is also {@condition grappled} in ice (escape {@dc 16}), and while {@condition grappled} in this way, the creature is {@condition restrained} and takes 24 ({@damage 7d6}) cold damage at the end of each of its turns.

action.name: Thrown Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.
{@note Blank in source, assumed same as {@creature Hill Giant Butcher|PKB}.}

The giant can attempt to catch a rock thrown at a target that is within 10 feet of itself. The giant makes a Dexterity saving throw against the attack roll of the attacking creature. If it succeeds, the giant catches the rock and the intended target takes no damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kellid graveknight's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}). The kellid graveknight can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Graveknight's Curse
entries: A living creature that dons the kellid graveknight's armor must succeed on a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw or be afflicted with the graveknight's curse. Cursed creatures cannot remove the kellid graveknight's armor and must repeat the saving throw at the end of each long rest. On a second failed save, the creature has disadvantage on death saving throws. On a third failed save, the creature's speed is halved. On a fourth failed save, the creature dies and transforms into the armor's kellid graveknight. A successful saving throw lifts the curse, and the armor falls off. The creature is subject to the curse if it dons the armor again.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If a kellid graveknight is destroyed, its armor regrows its body in {@dice 1d10} days. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts. A kellid graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor with a {@spell disintegrate} spell, transporting it to the Positive Energy Plane, or by throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

trait.name: Ruinous Energy
entries: A Kellid graveknight is infused with cold. It is immune to cold damage, and its attacks and devastating blast deal cold damage as indicated below.

trait.name: Sacrilegious Aura
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of the kellid graveknight uses a spell or ability that magically restores hit points, the creature must make a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the creature's spell or ability fails and has no effect.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kellid graveknight makes three maul attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Devastating Blast {@recharge}
entries: The kellid graveknight unleashes a 30-foot cone of cold. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 49 ({@damage 14d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The kellid graveknight adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the kellid graveknight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Kereek is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Kereek has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, Kereek has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Kereek carries a {@item wand of burning hands|PKB}. The wand has 7 charges. Using an action to expend 1 charge, the wielder casts the {@spell burning hands} (save {@dc 15}) spell at 1st level. Kereek can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge expended. The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} charges daily at dawn. If the last charge is expended, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Kereek makes two dagger attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Wand of Burning Hands
entries: Kereek casts {@spell burning hands} using his wand.

trait.name: Kob's Ruinous Strike
entries: When Kob Moleg scores a critical hit with his greatclub, the target becomes {@condition frightened} of him for 1 minute.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant makes three greatclub attacks.

action.name: Striking Greatclub +2
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@dice 3d8 + 11}) bludgeoning and piercing damage. The greatclub has {@dice 1d10} charges (minimum of 3) at the start of the encounter. When the giant hits with a melee attack, he can expend up to 3 of the club's charges. For each charge it expends, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage. The greatclub otherwise works as a {@item staff of striking} but is sized for a Huge giant.

action.name: Wide Swing {@recharge 5}
entries: Kob Moleg swings his greatclub in a powerful circle. Every creature within 10 feet of the giant must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 24 ({@damage 3d8 + 11}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. The giant can expend charges from its greatclub of striking to increase this damage.

reaction.name: Catch Rock
entries: Kob Moleg can attempt to catch a rock thrown at a target that is within 10 feet of itself. The giant makes a Dexterity saving throw against the attack roll of the attacking creature. If it succeeds, the giant catches the rock and the intended target takes no damage.

trait.name: Hurried Retreat
entries: The kobold scout can {@action Disengage} as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: The kobold deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the kobold that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the kobold doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Korog's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}). Korog can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Graveknight's Curse
entries: A living creature that dons Korog's armor must succeed on a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw or be afflicted with the graveknight's curse. Cursed creatures can't remove Korog's armor and must repeat the saving throw at the end of each long rest. On a second failed save, the creature has disadvantage on death saving throws.
