entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 20 ft./60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage.

trait.name: Cruel Anatomist (1/Turn)
entries: The Thresholder hermeticist deals an extra 31 ({@damage 9d6}) damage when it hits with a melee weapon attack if the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the Thresholder hermeticist's that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Juggernaut
entries: The Thresholder hermeticist has advantage on all Constitution saving throws.

trait.name: Outside of Time
entries: The Thresholder hermeticist exists outside of time; it doesn't age, doesn't need food or drink to survive, and can't be affected by the {@spell haste} or {@spell slow} spells unless it chooses to be.

trait.name: Unseen Sight
entries: The Thresholder has the ability to see the truth of the world, granting them {@sense darkvision} and {@sense truesight} to a distance of 60 feet, as long as they remain in a region under Yog-Sothoth's influence.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Thresholder hermeticist makes four dagger attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Enhanced Alchemist Fire (3/Day)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 20 ft./60 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 8d8}) fire damage. Creatures within 5 feet of the target must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking equal damage as the target on a failed saving throw, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Enhanced Healing Potion (3/Day)
entries: The Thresholder hermeticist drinks a potion and regains 18 ({@dice 4d8}) hit points, up to its hit point maximum.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Thresholder mystic is a 17th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks), and it needs only verbal components to cast its spells. It has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Outside of Time
entries: The Thresholder mystic exists outside of time; it doesn't age, doesn't need food or drink to survive, and can't be affected by the {@spell haste} or {@spell slow} spells unless it chooses to be.

trait.name: Resolve
entries: The Thresholder mystic has advantage on all Wisdom saving throws.

trait.name: Unseen Sight
entries: The Thresholder has the ability to see the truth of the world, granting it {@sense darkvision} and {@sense truesight} to a distance of 60 feet, as long as it remains in a region under Yog-Sothoth's influence.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Thresholder mystic makes four dagger attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Reminder of Doom
entries: The mystic reminds its allies of the punishments awaiting those who fail Yog-Sothoth. The mystic and its allies within 60 feet that can hear it gain advantage on their attack rolls for until the end of the Thresholder mystic's next turn.

trait.name: Powerful Jaws
entries: The thylacine's bite scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Rage
entries: The Tiger Lord can enter rage as a bonus action. While raging, the Tiger Lord has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, they deal an additional 2 damage with each attack, and they gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. The rage lasts for 1 minute., or until the Tiger Lord falls {@condition unconscious}, or if their turn ends and they haven't either attacked a hostile creature or taken damage since their last turn.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of their turn, the Tiger Lord can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against them have advantage until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The {@homebrew Tiger Lord|barbarian} makes two attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage if held with two hands.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Creature of Primal Magic
entries: The tor linnorm is constantly under the effects of {@spell freedom of movement}.

trait.name: Curse of Boiling Blood
entries: When a creature slays a tor linnorm, it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or gain vulnerability to fire, and gain two permanent levels of {@condition exhaustion}. This curse is treated as the spell {@spell bestow curse} cast from a 9th level slot.

trait.name: Draconic Nature
entries: The tor linnorm does not age, and magic can't put the linnorm to sleep.

trait.name: Lava Affinity
entries: The tor linnorm can breathe and swim freely while submerged in lava and magma.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the tor linnorm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The tor linnorm has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The tor linnorm regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn. If the linnorm takes cold damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The linnorm dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tor linnorm makes four attacks: once with its bite, twice with its claws, and once with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 2d12 + 10}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage, and the target must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage and gaining the {@condition poisoned} condition on a failed save, or half as much damage and is not {@condition poisoned} on a successful one.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d4 + 10}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Ashen Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The tor linnorm exhales flame and ash in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 70 ({@damage 20d6}) fire damage and becoming {@condition blinded} for 1 minute on a failed save. Such a creature takes half as much damage and does not become {@condition blinded} on a successful one. The area of the cone is filled with thick, scorching smoke that burns the lungs and eyes until the end of the linnorm's next turn. Creatures that end their turn in the lingering ash cloud take 35 ({@damage 10d6}) fire damage and must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition blinded} for 1 minute.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The tor linnorm makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The tor linnorm makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Stoke the Fires (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The linnorm focuses its internal fire gland, allowing it to roll immediately to recharge its breath weapon.

trait.name: Eerie Flexibility
entries: A trapdoor ogre spider can move through any space large enough for a Large creature.

trait.name: Trapdoor Lunge
entries: If the spider surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage from the attack. The spider can then move up to its speed.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} this way.

trait.name: Dead Tree
entries: While the tree that weeps remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal dead tree.

trait.name: Ripping Disarm
entries: If a hostile creature has disadvantage on its melee attacks and misses the tree that weeps, the attacking creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or have their weapon disarmed and discarded within 10 feet of them in a square of the tree that weep's choice.

trait.name: Weeping Aura
entries: When the tree that weeps isn't using Dead Tree, creatures that start their turn within 30 feet of it must succeed a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the start of its next turn. After it recovers from the paralysis, the creature is {@condition frightened} of the tree that weeps until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Woodland Ambush
entries: When the tree that weeps successfully attacks a creature that was unaware of its presence, it deals an additional 11 ({@damage 2d10}) slashing damage on its attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tree that weeps makes four scythe branch attacks.

action.name: Scythe Branch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d10 + 9}) slashing damage and the target must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Tristian is a 10th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: {@item +1 Shield|DMG|Shield +1}, 2 {@item holy symbol|PHB|holy symbols}, a prayer {@item book|PHB}, 5 sticks of incense, vestments, a set of {@item common clothes|PHB}, {@item splint armor|PHB}, {@item mace|PHB}, {@item light crossbow|PHB} and {@item Crossbow Bolts (20)|PHB|20 bolts}, {@item priest's pack|PHB}, 625 gp.

trait.name: Blessed Healer
entries: The healing spells Tristian casts on others heals him as well. When he casts a spell of 1st level or higher that restores hit points to a creature other than himself, he regains hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.

trait.name: Destroy Undead
entries: When an undead of CR 1/2 or lower fails its saving throw against Tristian's Turn Undead feature, the creature is instantly destroyed.

trait.name: Disciple of Life
entries: Whenever Tristian uses a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature, the creature regains additional hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.

trait.name: Divine Strike
entries: Tristian has the ability to infuse his strikes with divine energy. Once on each of his turns when he hits a creature with a weapon attack, he can cause the attack to deal an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage to the target.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d6 - 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Channel Divinity (2/Day)
entries: Tristian has two options for his Channel Divinity:

items.name: Preserve Life
entries: Tristian can present his {@item holy symbol|PHB} to evoke healing energy that can restore a number of hit points equal to 50. Tristian chooses any creatures within 30 feet of him and divides those hit points among them. This feature can restore a creature to no more than half of its hit point maximum. He can't use this feature on an undead or construct.

items.name: Turn Undead
entries: Tristian presents his {@item holy symbol|PHB} and speaks a prayer censuring the undead. Each undead that can see or hear him within 30 feet must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from Tristian as it can and it can't willingly move to a square within 30 feet of him. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can only use the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the {@action Dodge} action.

action.name: Divine Intervention
entries: Tristian can call on Sarenrae to intervene on his behalf when his need is great. He describes the assistance he needs and rolls {@dice d100|percentile dice}. If he rolls a number equal to or less than 10, Sarenrae intervenes. The GM chooses the nature of the intervention; the effect of any cleric spell or cleric domain spell would be appropriate. If Sarenrae intervenes, he can't use this feature again for 7 days. Otherwise he can use it again after he finishes a long rest.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Tristian is a 1st-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: 2 {@item holy symbol|PHB|holy symbols}, a prayer {@item book|PHB}, 5 sticks of incense, vestments, a set of {@item common clothes|PHB}, and a {@item pouch|PHB} containing 15 gp, {@item splint armor|PHB}, {@item mace|PHB}, {@item light crossbow|PHB} and {@item Crossbow Bolts (20)|PHB|20 bolts}, {@item priest's pack|PHB}, {@item scale mail|PHB}, {@item shield|PHB}.

trait.name: Disciple of Life
entries: Whenever Tristian uses a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature, the creature regains additional hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d6 - 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The troll guard has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the troll guard hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The troll guard has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The troll guard regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn. If it takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll guard's next turn. The troll guard dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The troll guard makes three melee attacks, two with its greataxe and one with its bite, or two with its claws and one with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d6 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 3d12 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: A troll king has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The troll regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The troll king uses its primordial roar if available, then makes three attacks, one with its bite and two with its claws. If the troll king successfully hits the same creature with both claw attacks, it rends the target, dealing an additional 14 ({@damage 4d6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Primordial Roar {@recharge 5}
entries: The troll king unleashes a bestial roar. Each creature within 100 feet that is not a troll and can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The trollhound has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing and smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The trollhound regains 5 hit points at the start of his turn. If it takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the trollhound's next turn. The trollhound dies only if it starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Tulvak's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 spell attack). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Tulvak can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: Tulvak can mimic animal sounds and human voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 17} Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Tulvak makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage and the target must succeed at a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Scythe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Exhale Miasma {@recharge 5}
entries: Tulvak exhales a miasma of green vapors in a 15-foot cone. All creatures in the area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute.

trait.name: Bramble Jump
entries: A twigjack does not treat spaces filled with undergrowth as {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. On its turn, a twigjack can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into undergrowth within its reach and emerge from a second area of undergrowth within 60 feet of the first undergrowth, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second undergrowth.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The twigjack makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Splinter
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Splinter Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The twigjack sends a volley of splinters in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The two-headed troll has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The two-headed troll regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn. If it takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the two-headed troll's next turn. The two-headed troll dies only if it starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The two-headed troll makes four attacks: two with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: A set of {@item fine clothes|PHB}, a {@item signet ring|PHB}, a scroll of pedigree, a purse containing 25 gp, {@item chain mail|PHB}, {@item maul|PHB}, {@item pike|PHB}, {@item light crossbow|PHB} and {@item Crossbow Bolts (20)|PHB|20 bolts}, {@item explorer's pack|PHB}.

trait.name: Great Weapon Fighting
entries: When Valerie rolls a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack she makes with a melee weapon that she is wielding with two hands, she can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the {@itemProperty 2H||two-handed} or {@itemProperty V||versatile} property for her to gain this benefit.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Second Wind
entries: Valerie has a limited well of stamina that she can draw on to protect herself from harm. She can regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d10 + 1}. Once she uses this feature she must finish a short or long rest before she can use it again.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: A set of {@item fine clothes|PHB}, a {@item signet ring|PHB}, a scroll of pedigree, a purse containing 25 gp, {@item chain mail|PHB}, {@item maul|PHB}, {@item pike|PHB}, {@item light crossbow|PHB} and {@item Crossbow Bolts (20)|PHB|20 bolts}, {@item explorer's pack|PHB}.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: {@item +1 Chain Mail|DMG}, a set of {@item fine clothes|PHB}, a {@item signet ring|PHB}, a scroll of pedigree, {@item maul|PHB}, {@item pike|PHB}, {@item light crossbow|PHB} and {@item Crossbow Bolts (20)|PHB|20 bolts}, {@item explorer's pack|PHB}, 650 gp.

trait.name: Great Weapon Fighting
entries: When Valerie rolls a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack she makes with a melee weapon that she is wielding with two hands, she can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the {@itemProperty 2H||two-handed} or {@itemProperty V||versatile} property for her to gain this benefit.

trait.name: Improved Critical
entries: Valerie's weapons score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Indomitable
entries: Valerie can reroll saving throw that she fails. If she does so, she must use the new roll, and she can't use this feature again until she finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Remarkable Athlete
entries: Valerie adds half her proficiency bonus (round up) to any Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution check she makes that doesn't already use her proficiency bonus. In addition, when making a running long jump, the distance she can cover increases by 5 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Valerie makes two attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Second Wind
entries: Valerie has a limited well of stamina that she can draw on to protect herself from harm. She can regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d10 + 9}. Once she uses this feature she must finish a short or long rest before she can use it again.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Corrode Metal
entries: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the ooze corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the ooze is destroyed after dealing damage. The ooze can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.

trait.name: Enliven
entries: A 15-foot-radius verdant green haze emits from the ooze, moves with it, and spreads around corners.
The area is affected as though under the {@spell entangle} spell, though this effect can't be dispelled.

trait.name: Sleep Aura
entries: A 60-foot-radius mist of chemicals emits from the ooze, moves with it, and spreads around corners. Creatures that enter this area for the first time, or start their turn in it, must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. A sleeping creature can repeat the saving throw if it takes damage, or if another creature uses an action to shake the creature. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this verdurous ooze's sleep aura for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Split
entries: When a verdurous ooze that is Medium is subject to piercing or slashing damage, it splits into two new oozes if it has at least 10 hit points. Each new ooze has hit points equal to half the original ooze's, rounded down. New oozes are one size smaller than the original ooze, and their sleep aura is reduced to 30 feet. Creatures who have successfully saved against the original ooze's sleep aura are immune to the aura of both new oozes. These oozes are capable of recombining after 1 minute, adding their remaining hit points together.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage, and if the target is wearing nonmagical metal armor, its armor is partly corroded and takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this {@action grapple} ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the ooze can't {@action grapple} another target. If the {@condition grappled} target is wearing nonmagical metal armor, its armor is partly corroded and takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

trait.name: Brave
entries: Vesket has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: Vesket can hold his breath for 15 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Vesket makes three melee attacks, two with his trident and one with his bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage, or 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy a creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Small ant. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm can attack every creature in its space with swarming bites.

action.name: Swarming Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@dice 2d6}) if the swarm has half of its hit points or lower, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the start of the swarm's next turn. On a success, the target takes half as much poison damage and is not {@condition poisoned}.

reaction.name: Cling
entries: When a creature leaves the swarm's space, the army ant swarm can use its reaction to cling to that creature. If it does so, the amount of the swarm that was in the target's space moves with the creature, splitting the swarm if the creature is Medium or smaller. Each part of the swarm acts on the same initiative. The clinging swarm has one-quarter of the swarm's remaining hit points, removing those hit points from the swarm's current total. Any separated portion of the swarm can continue to make swarming bite attacks. A creature can use its action to brush the ants off with a contested {@action grapple} check. If underwater or in high winds, the creature has advantage on its ability check.
With a success, the creature removes itself from the swarm's area, and the remaining ants return to the main swarm without provoking an {@action Opportunity Attack|PHB|attack of opportunity}.

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that are not cold iron

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: A vilderavn herald's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). A vilderavn herald can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Bloodraven
entries: The vilderavn's attacks carry a curse. When a creature other than a construct, elemental, ooze, or undead takes damage from the vilderavn's melee attacks, the target loses 7 ({@dice 2d6}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to a cursed wound. Each time the vilderavn hits the wounded target with a melee attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 7 ({@dice 2d6}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 16} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing or is the recipient of {@spell remove curse}.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The vilderavn herald doesn't provoke an {@action opportunity attack} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The vilderavn herald has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Raven Knight
entries: When a vilderavn herald assumes humanoid form with its change shape ability, it gains a magical greatsword formed from its vicious talons. This is part of the vilderavn herald's being and disappears when it is slain.

trait.name: Shatter Loyalties
entries: A vilderavn herald's frightful presence creates disloyalty, doubt, and dissension in addition to fear. Creatures that fail their saves are no longer treated as allies to other creatures and can't use the {@action Help} action or allow other creatures to move through their space. Any spell or effect that requires a willing target fails if used on an affected creature, and even harmless effects require an attack roll (if applicable) and require affected creatures to attempt a saving throw to resist their effects (if a save is allowed). Creatures that are immune to fear can still be affected by the shatter loyalties ability of a vilderavn herald's frightful presence; they ignore the {@condition frightened} condition but are otherwise affected as described above.

trait.name: Soul Eater
entries: A vilderavn herald's bite attack scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. If a vilderavn herald kills a humanoid with a critical hit from its bite attack, it can tear out the victim's heart and consume its soul, killing the creature immediately. Creatures that witness this must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. While the target remains dead, the vilderavn herald gains access to that creature's memories and can use its change shape ability to assume a perfect likeness of the slain creature, gaining advantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception}) checks made to impersonate it. The vilderavn herald can store any number of souls. Slaying the vilderavn herald ends all its ongoing soul eater effects and frees any stored souls.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vilderavn herald can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: two with its claws and once with its bite or with its greatsword.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 6d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 6d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Cruel Keen Greatsword (Humanoid form only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}38 ({@damage 6d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The vilderavn magically polymorphs into a Medium humanoid, a wolf, or a wolf/raven hybrid (a wolf with talons and wings or a Small raven with a wolf's head). The humanoid form's breastplate and greatsword are absorbed in the vilderavn's beast and hybrid forms; all other equipment falls to the ground.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the vilderavn herald's choice that is within 120 feet of the vilderavn herald and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the vilderavn herald's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Mobility
entries: The vilderavn herald moves up to its speed. This movement does not provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The vilderavn herald makes an attack with its bite or greatsword.

legendary.name: Resist
entries: The vilderavn herald ends one condition currently effecting it.

trait.name: Flaming Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage plus {@damage 1d8} fire damage when Villamor hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Villamor makes three greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage.

reaction.name: Counterattack
entries: When struck by an enemy with a melee weapon, Villamor makes one greataxe attack against the creature that hit him.

trait.name: Cold Lethargy
entries: Exposure to any cold effect slows a viper vine as a {@spell slow} spell.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the vine remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The viper vine uses captivating cloud (if available) then makes four vine attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d6 + 8}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@dice 2d6}) acid.

action.name: Vine
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 25 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@dice 1d6 + 8}) bludgeoning plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}).

action.name: Captivating Cloud (1/Day)
entries: A viper vine emits a transparent cloud of pollen in a 60-foot radius that has the power to lull the minds of those that smell it. Once activated, the cloud persists for 1 minute unless dispersed by moderate or stronger wind. All creatures in the cloud must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw each round or become {@condition charmed}. A {@condition charmed} creature takes no actions save to approach the viper vine via the most direct route possible. If this path leads it into a dangerous area, such as through fire or off a cliff, that creature receives a second saving throw to end the effect before moving into peril. A {@condition charmed} creature can repeat the saving throw each time it is attacked by the viper vine, ending the effect on a success.

reaction.name: Feasting Grasp
entries: The viper vine can make a bite attack against a {@condition grappled} foe when the target becomes {@condition grappled}, the creature tries to escape, or the creature attacks the viper vine.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Virthad is a 7th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks), and they need only verbal components to cast their spells. They have the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: Virthad has advantage on attack rolls against any creature they have surprised.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If Virthad surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage from the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Virthad makes three dogslicer attacks.

action.name: Dogslicer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Deploy Flytraps (1/Day)
entries: Virthad dumps seed pods from a sack onto two squares within 5 feet while invoking prayers to Lamashtu. The pods grow into two {@creature snapping flytrap|PKB|snapping flytraps} that immediately attack any non-worshipper of Lamashtu they can detect. The {@creature snapping flytrap|PKB|snapping flytraps} act on Virthad's subsequent turns.

action.name: Read Thoughts
entries: Virthad magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 feet. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, Virthad can continue reading its thoughts, as long as Virthad's {@status concentration} isn't broken (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). While reading the target's mind, Virthad has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) and Charisma ({@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, and {@skill Persuasion}) checks against the target.

action.name: Shapechanger
entries: Virthad polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid they have seen, or back into their true form. Their statistics, other than their size, are the same in each form. Any equipment they are wearing or carrying isn't transformed. Virthad reverts to their true form if they die.

trait.name: Opportunist
entries: Volodmyra has advantage on all {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

trait.name: Spinning Sweep
entries: Every time Volodmyra hits a creature with a greataxe attack, she increases her speed by 10 feet until the end of her turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Volodmyra makes two greataxe attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Overhead Smash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d12 + 4}) slashing damage plus the target must succeed a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Vordakai is a 9th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). Vordakai has the following wizard spells prepared.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Vordakai fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: Vordakai has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a successful save.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: Vordakai casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Paralyzing Touch (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Vordakai uses his paralyzing touch.

legendary.name: Frightening Gaze (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Vordakai fixes his gaze on one creature he can see within 10 feet of him. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to Vordakai's gaze for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Disrupt Life (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Each living creature within 20 feet of Vordakai must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warsworn's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 19}). The warsworn can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Absorb the Dead
entries: A warsworn can consume any dying creature by moving into its space. The creature immediately dies and is absorbed into the warsworn, healing the warsworn by an amount equal to the creature's Constitution score. Absorbed creatures can't be returned to life except by a wish as long as the warsworn exists. If the warsworn is destroyed, absorbed creatures can be brought back to life with the appropriate magic.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the warsworn moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a slam attack on the same target, that target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the warsworn can make one slam attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warsworn makes three attacks: two with its slam and one attack with its scrap ball.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 6d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Scrap Ball
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 20 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 8d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (1/Day)
headerEntries: The mephit can innately cast {@spell stinking cloud}, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}).

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of high-pressure water. Each creature within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the mephit remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary puddle of water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The water mephit makes two attacks with its claws.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage and 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Acid Breath {@recharge}
entries: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of acid. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Thorny Mass
entries: A creature that touches the wemmuth or hits it with a melee attack while within 10 feet of it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wemmuth makes two melee attacks, or it makes one melee attack and uses Squeeze.

action.name: Pummeling Branch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}36 ({@damage 8d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}) and {@condition restrained} until the {@action grapple} ends. The wemmuth has four pummeling branches, each of which can {@action grapple} one target.

action.name: Boulder
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one creature. {@h}61 ({@damage 10d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Squeeze
entries: The wemmuth crushes a {@condition grappled} creature, absorbing its life-giving blood. The {@condition grappled} creature must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a successful one. The wemmuth regains hit points total to half the damage dealt.

action.name: Flail {@recharge 5}
entries: The wemmuth makes four pummeling branch attacks, each with disadvantage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Werendegar's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks). Werendegar can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when Werendegar hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Hungersense
entries: Werendegar has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks made against creatures that require food to live.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Werendegar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Werendegar's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: Werendegar can use his action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid he has seen, or back into his true form. His statistics, other than his size, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. Werendegar reverts to his true form if he dies.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: Werendegar deals an extra 21 ({@damage 6d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the creature that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and Werendegar doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Thorny Aura
entries: Thorny roots and barbed vines writhe and twist in a 15-foot radius around Werendegar. When a creature moves into this area for the first time or ends its turn in it, the creature must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage. Werendegar is not affected by his own thorny aura.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Werendegar makes three attacks: one with his rapier, one with a claw, and one with a bite.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Disarm
entries: If Werendegar successfully hits a creature with his rapier and that creature is wielding a weapon, he can opt to deal no damage and instead cause the creature to make a {@dc 21} Strength saving throw. If the creature fails, they drop their weapon to the ground.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The whimwyrm's spell casting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Fog Vision
entries: Fog and mist, including from spells, don't affect the whimwyrm's vision.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the whimwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The whimwyrm makes four attacks: one with its bite and three with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 5d8 + 5}) slashing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or the whimwyrm can disarm the target of one object it is holding. The object falls up to 10 feet away from the target in a space of the whimwyrm's choosing.

action.name: Mind-Numbing Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The whimwyrm exhales a 40-foot cone of sparkling magenta mist. A creature within the area must make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) psychic damage and becoming {@condition blinded} for 1 minute on a failure. On a successful save, a creature takes half the amount of damage and is not {@condition blinded}. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. Additionally, any creatures in this area that fail their saving throw that were {@condition invisible} become visible for 1 minute as if any effects causing the invisibility were paused; all such effects resume once the minute ends.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wild hunt archer's spell casting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Greensight
entries: The wild hunt archer ignores leaves and other foliage when determining cover for a target.

trait.name: Instinctive Cooperation
entries: The wild hunt archer has advantage on saving throws against effects caused by other members of the wild hunt.

trait.name: Planar Acclimation
entries: The wild hunt archer always treats the plane it is currently on as its native plane.

trait.name: Wild Gaze
entries: Those who meet the gaze of a wild hunt archer come face-to-face with the hunt's fearful power and find it difficult to act in the face of such a legendary legacy. When a creature ends its turn within 30 feet of the wild hunt archer, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be slowed as if it were affected by the {@spell slow} spell until the end of its next turn. This aura can be disabled or turned on as a bonus action.

trait.name: Wild Hunt Link
entries: All members of the wild hunt within 500 feet of the wild hunt archer, including the archer itself, ignore half cover and three-quarters cover with their ranged weapon attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wild hunt archer makes two attacks with its antler gore or three attacks with its living bow, or one antler gore attack and two attacks with its {@homebrew living bow|longbow}.

action.name: Antler Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Living Bow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) piercing damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage. The wild hunt archer spontaneously generates arrows as needed from its quiver when using its living bow. If the bow is taken from the archer or lost, the living bow rots away in 1 hour. A wild hunt archer can manifest a replacement living bow by {@status concentration||concentrating} for one minute.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wild hunt horse's spell casting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Greensight
entries: The wild hunt horse ignores leaves and other foliage when determining cover for a target.

trait.name: Instinctive Cooperation
entries: The wild hunt horse has advantage on saving throws against effects caused by other members of the wild hunt.

trait.name: Planar Acclimation
entries: A wild hunt horse always treats the plane it is currently on as its native plane.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the wild hunt horse moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the wild hunt horse can make a hooves attack against the target as a bonus action.

trait.name: Wild Gaze
entries: Those who meet the gaze of a wild hunt horse come face-to-face with the hunt's fearful power and find it difficult to act in the face of such a legendary legacy. When a creature ends its turn within 30 feet of the wild hunt horse, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be slowed as if it were affected by the {@spell slow} spell until the end of its next turn. This aura can be disabled or turned on as a bonus action.

trait.name: Wild Hunt Link
entries: All members of the wild hunt within 500 feet of the wild hunt horse, including the horse itself, increase their speed by 10 feet (included in Speed).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wild hunt horse makes three attacks, one with its bite and two with its hooves.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 3d12 + 9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d10 + 9}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bewildering Hoofbeats
entries: The wild hunt horse can make it seem as though hundreds of horses are approaching from all directions. Each creature within 60 feet of the wild hunt horse that can hear must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is confused as per the {@spell confusion} spell for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. On a successful save, is the creature is immune to bewildering hoofbeats for 1 hour.

action.name: Deafening Cry (3/Day)
entries: The wild hunt horse emits a thundering cry in a 30-foot radius around itself. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 56 ({@damage 16d6}) thunder damage and becomes {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. A creature takes half as much damage on a success and does not become {@condition deafened}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wild hunt hound's spell casting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Greensight
entries: The wild hunt hound ignores leaves and other foliage when determining cover for a target.

trait.name: Instinctive Cooperation
entries: The wild hunt hound has advantage on saving throws against effects caused by other members of the wild hunt.

trait.name: Planar Acclimation
entries: A wild hunt hound always treats the plane it is currently on as its native plane.

trait.name: Wild Gaze
entries: Those who meet the gaze of a wild hunt hound come face-to-face with the hunt's fearful power and find it difficult to act in the face of such a legendary legacy. When a creature ends its turn within 30 feet of the wild hunt hound, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be slowed as if it were affected by the {@spell slow} spell until the end of its next turn. This aura can be disabled or turned on as a bonus action.

trait.name: Wild Hunt Link
entries: All members of the wild hunt within 500 feet of the wild hunt hound, including the hound itself, are treated as if they have {@spell see invisibility} cast on them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wild hunt hound can use Focus Gaze. It then makes three bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed at a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Focus Gaze
entries: The wild hunt hound fixes its glare at a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be affected by the wild hunt hound's Wild Gaze. If the target is already slowed by the Wild Gaze, it instead becomes {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Summon Pack
entries: With a haunting howl, the wild hunt hound summons a fog that manifests into several misty hounds.
These foggy hounds shift and race and howl in a 20-foot radius around the wild hunt hound as long as it maintains the effect as though it were {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wild hunt monarch's spell casting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when a wild hunt monarch hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Call to the Hunt (1/Day)
entries: A wild hunt monarch can blow his hunt monarch's horn as a bonus action to summon one {@creature wild hunt scout|PKB} or two {@creature wild hunt archer|PKB|wild hunt archers}. They appear within 100 feet of him at locations he chooses, and they remain on the same plane for 1 hour or until reduced to 0 hit points. They share a telepathic bond up to one mile to coordinate their hunting tactics. In the hands of any other creature, a hunt monarch's horn functions as a regular horn.

trait.name: Greensight
entries: The wild hunt monarch ignores leaves and other foliage when determining cover for a target.

trait.name: Instinctive Cooperation
entries: The wild hunt monarch has advantage on saving throws against effects caused by other members of the wild hunt.

trait.name: Monarch's Glaive
entries: A wild hunt monarch wields a {@item +3 Glaive|DMG|glaive +3} that deals thunder damage on every hit. When the monarch successfully strikes a creature, the glaive alters its own nature, becoming a bane to that creature on all subsequent attacks. Until the monarch strikes another creature, the glaive deals 10 ({@dice 3d6}) necrotic additional damage on each successful strike to the creature it is a bane against. A wild hunt monarch can summon their glaive to their hand across any distance as a bonus action. If the wild hunt monarch dies, the glaive becomes a {@item +3 Glaive|DMG|glaive +3} with no other properties.

trait.name: Planar Acclimation
entries: A wild hunt monarch always treats the plane it is currently on as its native plane.

trait.name: Wild Gaze
entries: Those who meet the gaze of a wild hunt monarch come face-to-face with the hunt's fearful power and find it difficult to act in the face of such a legendary legacy. When a creature ends its turn within 30 feet of the wild hunt monarch, it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or be slowed as if it were affected by the {@spell slow} spell until the end of its next turn. This aura can be disabled or turned on as a bonus action.

trait.name: Wild Hunt Link
entries: The wild hunt monarch increases the range of all other wild hunt links to 1 mile. In addition, any member of the wild hunt other than monarchs within 60 feet of a wild hunt monarch regain 10 hit points at the start of its turn, as long as the wild hunt monarch remains alive and conscious.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wild hunt monarch makes three attacks with his glaive.

action.name: Monarch's Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) slashing damage and 4 ({@damage 1d8}) thunder damage. Once it strikes a living creature, the glaive deals 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage on all subsequent strikes against that creature.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The wild hunt monarch moves up to its speed. This does not provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks}.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The wild hunt monarch makes an attack with its glaive.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The wild hunt monarch casts one innate spell.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wild hunt scout's spell casting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Crystal Attack
entries: A wild hunt scout can manifest a green crystal in their free hand as a bonus action; this crystal vanishes as soon as it leaves their possession. The crystal is necessary for the wild hunt scout to use its Emerald Beam attack.

trait.name: Greensight
entries: The wild hunt scout ignores leaves and other foliage when determining cover for a target.

trait.name: Instinctive Cooperation
entries: The wild hunt scout has advantage on saving throws against effects caused by other members of the wild hunt.

trait.name: Planar Acclimation
entries: A wild hunt scout always treats the plane it is currently on as its native plane.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the wild hunt scout surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage from the attack.

trait.name: Wild Gaze
entries: Those who meet the gaze of a wild hunt scout come face-to-face with the hunt's fearful power and find it difficult to act in the face of such a legendary legacy. When a creature ends its turn within 30 feet of the wild hunt scout, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or be slowed as if it were affected by the {@spell slow} spell until the end of its next turn. This aura can be disabled or turned on as a bonus action.

trait.name: Wild Hunt Link
entries: All members of the wild hunt within 500 feet of the wild hunt scout, including the scout itself, can't be surprised.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wild hunt scout makes three attacks with its crystal scimitar, or twice with its crystal scimitar and one with its emerald beam.

action.name: Crystal Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) slashing damage and 13 ({@damage 3d8}) force damage.

action.name: Emerald Beam
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 13} to hit, range 40/100 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 5d6}) force damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition blinded} for 1 minute.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If Windchaser moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a hoof attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, Windchaser can make another attack with its hoof against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Windchaser makes two attacks with its hooves.

action.name: Hoof
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries: The winged owlbear has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight and smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The winged owlbear makes three melee attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 6d8 + 7}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: Xae can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when she is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: Xae can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. She takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Xae makes two withering touch attacks.

action.name: Withering Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 7d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: Xae enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. She is visible on the Material Plane while she is in the Ethereal Plane, and vice versa, yet can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The xill has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The xill makes five melee attacks: one with its bite and four with its claws, or one with its bite and four weapons. It can also make four ranged attacks with a pair of longbows (two per bow).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Implant
entries: The xill can lay {@dice 2d6} eggs in an {@condition incapacitated} creature. The xill's eggs hatch in 24 hours, at which point the young consume the host from within, inflicting 1 point of Con damage per hour per young until the host dies. The young then emerge and planewalk to the Ethereal Plane, if possible, to mature. A {@spell lesser restoration} spell (or similar effect) rids a victim of all implanted eggs or active young, or they can be cut out one at a time with {@dc 15} {@skill Medicine} checks (each attempt takes 10 minutes). If a check fails, the healer can try again, but each attempt (successful or not) deals 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage to the patient.

action.name: Planewalk
entries: The xill shifts from the Ethereal Plane to the Material Plane or vice versa. The xill can take a single willing or {@condition incapacitated} creature with it when it switches planes.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zombie hulk makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Throw Body
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 10/60 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. While the zombie hulk can throw any dead body in this way, it sometimes throws {@filter zombies of Medium size or smaller|bestiary|source=|size=t;s;m|search=zombie}. In this case, the thrown zombie also takes the damage from the attack, and lands {@condition prone}, but if it is not destroyed, it can rise and act normally on its turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zomok makes four melee attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws, and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the zomok. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the zomok, and it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the zomok's turns.

If the zomok takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the zomok must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the zomok. If the zomok dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The zomok exhales a blast of dirt, bark, stones, and moss in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 52 ({@damage 15d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Any creature that fails its save and is touching the ground is also {@condition restrained} (escape {@dc 18}) for 1 minute by this material.

action.name: Forest Step (3/Day)
entries: When in a forested area, the zomok may teleport up to 120 feet by moving the essence of its being to another forested area. The zomok regains 60 points when it manifests at its destination. If the zomok has swallowed a foe, the foe is left behind when the zomok teleports.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Zorek is a 12th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). He has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Brute
entries: A weapon deals one extra damage die when Zorek hits with it (included in attack).

trait.name: Stalwart
entries: Zorek gains advantage on all saving throws against spells and magical effects that have an effect other than damage (even if the spell also deals damage). If such an effect gives additional saving throws each turn, Zorek gains advantage on those saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Zorek makes two attacks.

action.name: Warspear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

monsterFluff.name: Accomplished Mitflit
entries: These two mitflits {@homebrew (Dingetooth and Uurch)} are more accomplished than most of their kind, although their choice to focus their efforts on a marble launcher might not be the most efficient use of their training. You can use these statistics for any mitflit gremlin that's managed the luck and skill to live long enough to hone their combat prowess—whether or not you let them keep their marble launcher. Of course, switching the type of damage the marble launcher deals when it hits a target also lets you change the launcher into a {@creature Accomplished Mitflit (Glass Slinger)|PKB|glass slinger (slashing damage)}, a {@creature Accomplished Mitflit (Coal Flinger)|PKB|coal flinger (fire damage)}, or a {@creature Accomplished Mitflit (Poison Toad-Launcher)|PKB|poison toad-launcher (poison damage)}.

monsterFluff.name: Adamantine Golem
entries: Crafted from a nigh-indestructible black metal of great rarity, adamantine golems are legendary in their danger, for destroying them completely requires weapons forged of the same metal they are built of or the use of powerful magic. They typically are enormous constructs with imposing, bulky facades, but some crafters build smaller, sleeker adamantine golems (such as the ones encountered in the Lantern Kingdom). Regardless of their size, though, these powerful constructs represent some of the most deadly foes of their kind any adventurer might face in their careers.

monsterFluff.name: Aecora Silverfire
entries: Aecora Silverfire is the leader of the Nomen tribe of centaurs who dwell in the easternmost reaches of the Stolen Lands. You can use Aecora's stats for any Desna-worshipping centaur, such as a potential ally wandering PCs might encounter in the wild. If you do so, though, consider changing her alignment from chaotic neutral to chaotic good, since most worshippers of the goddess of luck and travel are, like her, more kind and forgiving in nature than Aecora is.

monsterFluff.name: Agai
entries: Agai is the leader of the Culcheck spriggans, the band who invades the village of Varnhold after {@creature Vordakai|PKB} steals away its people. While Agai can work well in your game as the leader of other spriggan enclaves, he also works well as an unusual member of a rival adventuring party, particularly one based on a composition of more monstrous members than a group composed mostly of humans and other core options.

monsterFluff.name: Akiros Ismort
entries: Akiros Ismort is a fallen paladin who joined the {@creature Stag Lord|PKB|Stag Lord's} bandits, but has come to realize that particular lifestyle is even more hollow than he anticipated. His unusual class combination makes him a great choice for any sort of "fallen knight" in your game—someone who has abandoned civilization to live in the wild, perhaps. Whether or not he can be redeemed and returned to his prior faith is left to your party to decide.

monsterFluff.name: Akuzhail
entries: Transformed and mutated by the Cult of the Bloom, the warped chimera Akuzhail is now the host of the {@creature bloom of Lamashtu|PKB} {@homebrew |(page 122)}. While you can use Akuzhail as a unique mutant chimera in your own game, you can also use these statistics to represent an entire species of variant chimeras—perhaps a pride of these monsters dwell in the Mana Wastes, or maybe they're genetically engineered creatures that break loose from a buried zoological ship module in Numeria. They could even be used in play as fleshwarp monstrosities from Thassilon, Nexian fleshforges, or drow laboratories, especially if you change their narrative description from that of chimeras with the heads of vultures, centipedes, and rattlesnakes to something even more outlandish.

monsterFluff.name: Alasen
entries: The weretiger Alasen can be encountered in {@creature Castruccio Irovetti|PKB|King Irovetti's} palace in Pitax, where she's been staying as a guest. In Kingmaker, she's the leader of the Catspaw Mercenaries, but she can work just as well as the leader of any group of bandits or, even better, a tiger-themed thieves' guild. For a higher level party, you can use Alasen's statistics instead to represent an entire cult or secret society of high-level, deadly weretigers.

monsterFluff.name: Ameon Trask
entries: Ameon Trask is one of {@creature Hannis Drelev|PKB|Baron Drelev's} right-hand thugs. He is an unpleasant "pig of a man" who— despite being a poor leader—has been put in charge of one of the first military operations made against the PCs' kingdom. Ameon Trask can also play the role of a bounty hunter or even a specialist in a thieves' guild in other campaigns, as the balance between frontline combatant and stealthy stalker allows him to fit a wide range of villainous roles.

monsterFluff.name: Amiri (1st level)
entries: Amiri often claims to wield the power of giants and indicates her oversized sword as proof. Despite her bravado and fearlessness, she has an equally large need to prove her strength and find a place to belong. If the PCs treat her with respect, she might come to see them as her new family and eagerly protect them and their kingdom with all her considerable ferocity.

Amiri relies mostly on her incredible strength and bravery. She has little patience for academics, intrigue, or indirect approaches—and abhors cowards. Often crude, always hot-tempered, and continually full of impulsive bravado, she is perfectly aware of how strong and tough she is. As a result, Amiri stands ready to prove her bravery and might. No one would be faulted for thinking the boastful, brawny, and bull-headed barbarian fears nothing—she hides her insecurities about her past and her fear of not being allowed to belong deftly. Her confidence in her own capabilities can be, at times, misplaced or overestimated, but Amiri is not foolhardy. Faced with a situation where she has to admit that brute force won't prevail, her typical response is to seek other methods of success while continuing to hone her skills and increase her power. If such an alternative plan doesn't work, at least she has a good excuse to rely on what she knows best: brute force. Amiri values her oversized sword, and isn't easily persuaded to wield another weapon, although she will do so begrudgingly if tactics demand it.

monsterFluff.name: Ancient Will-o'-Wisp
entries: A will-o'-wisp that lingers in a region particularly suited to keeping it well-fed, such as an area under the influence of a tormented soul or other undead haunt, can over the course of decades become a much more powerful variant of its kind. Often, the vague image of a ghostly skull can be glimpsed floating within the depths of an ancient will-o'-wisp's glow.

monsterFluff.name: Ankou
entries: Ankous are shadowy killers who serve powerful fey creatures or demigods. Amid the courts of the Eldest or of powerful fey rulers, these sinister assassins lurk overhead as they await the call to action—implied threats akin to deadly weapons hung as decor in a royal hall. Two types of ankous play roles in Kingmaker— the typical ankou and the more dangerous assassins.

Ankous never speak aloud; when they feel the need to communicate at all, they do so in a telepathic whisper directly into a victim's mind (although they still must be able to understand the victim's language in order to communicate). While an ankou's body is made of strange, fleshy material, its claws and the cruel hooks on its wings are made of razor sharp cold iron, a quality that makes them feared among other fey. A typical ankou is 10 feet tall, has an 8-foot wingspan, and weighs less than 80 pounds.

items.name: Ankou Assassin
entries: The ankou assassins who serve {@creature Nyrissa|PKB} have trained in the arts of pain and slaughter, relying on their natural weapons to carry out their murderous missions. Ankou assassins like these could well serve other powerful fey, or even some of the Eldest as instruments of punishment.

monsterFluff.name: Annamede
entries: In the {@i Kingmaker Adventure Path}, Annamede is meant to be something of a nonviolent foil against the PCs: a bard in the employ of the nation of Pitax. She can play the role of any well-known public performer in your game, and with adjustments to her alignment can fit any sort of position related to entertainment you desire. Her skills also make her an excellent choice to play the role of a spy in your game, be it someone the PCs must defeat or an agent they must ally with. She works best when encountered with allies she can aid.

items.name: Antipaladin
entries: Antipaladins often serve as captains or secondary leaders for evil cults, particularly those associated with the worship of demon lords.

monsterFluff.name: Armag
